summary: Entrepreneur, speaker, ideator & thinker bringing the fractional & decentralized leadership model into the future of work. I‚Äôm a Fractional Futurist, helping fractional executives build million-dollar firms they can scale and eventually exit. Going from 0‚Äì1 is hard. Shifting from freelancer to founder is harder. That‚Äôs where I come in‚Äîwith strategy, structure, and the FROST Framework. I‚Äôm the co-founder of yorCMO, the first decentralized leadership franchise for fractional CMOs. And now, I‚Äôm scaling FractionalPros.com, a platform that connects SMBs with vetted fractional leaders‚Äîand helps those leaders find visibility, leads, and community through niche-driven peer pods. I believe in decentralized teams, strategic clarity, and the idea that every expert deserves a business model that works for them, not just because of them. I‚Äôve had a non-linear career and life. I‚Äôve: - Started a lawn care service in high school and sold the business before college - Studied and worked in chemical engineering - Founded 4 companies: from mortgage financing to media to data haptics tech - Published and written a book on media habits - Taught Entrepreneurship to university students - Created a documentary film on the seasons of entrepreneurship - Launched a community for fractional pros I spent years attempting to reconcile my wildly diverse experiences, let alone trying to explain them to those around me. Eventually, I realized that my decentralized nature was an asset: I could help other entrepreneurs engineer non-traditional, weird, unexpected and creative ideas into their businesses. Often it‚Äôs the simplest ideas that have the power to make a big impact & combust at scale. Board Member at Entrepreneurs‚Äô Organization (EO) Nebraska. I am also the host of a weekly podcast ‚ÄúThe Fractional C-Suite Retreat‚Äù featuring thought leaders on the future of work in the C-Suite. By day, professional tea and coffee drinker; by night, cigar enthusiast and living my best life with my wife and 4 children. Reach out to me for: ‚úîÔ∏è Discussions on how to leverage the power of fractional executive leaders in your business ‚úîÔ∏è Keynotes, talks & panel discussions on the fractional future of work ‚úîÔ∏è Good conversation over a cigar üìß joseph@yorcmo.com
job description: Do you have marketing PTSD? Looking for someone you can trust to lead your marketing efforts, to build and execute a strategic marketing plan aligned to your sales and growth goals? Is your business looking to pivot, scale, or exit? Do you need marketing expertise on your leadership team? Are you tired of spending money on marketing and not seeing sales results? We promise way better marketing with our fractional marketing approach at yorCMO. We connect you with an unbiased marketing expert - yorCMO - and begin with a marketing audit to establish your baseline. Then we build your marketing strategy during our foundation sessions, and finally we help you and your team execute with our quarterly action sessions and weekly check-ins. We are your outsourced or fractional Chief Marketing Officer - yorCMO.
linkedin description: Every business wants to grow, but far too many of them waste money on disorganized marketing tactics and strategies that, in the end, don‚Äôt support that goal. At yorCMO, we believe getting clear about your marketing goals and tactics is essential to your business‚Äôs success. Our goal is to help growth-minded CEOs gain someone they can trust to execute their marketing better than they are currently. Since 2016, we‚Äôve built a growing team of fractional CMOs, exclusively limited to those with decades of experience and proven leadership in various industries. As part of the yorCMO proven process, your CMO becomes a fiduciary partner, building your customized strategy and executing it in a way that drives up sales, without wasting any more of your time or money. But our work could never be possible by simply remaining in the ‚Äúoutsider‚Äù role that is so common among marketing consultants, agencies, and vendors. That‚Äôs why when you partner with us, we‚Äôre more than a consultant. We‚Äôre on your team‚Äí but for a fraction of the cost of adding on another full-time employee. Our results-driven fractional CMO model is designed to allow us to integrate with your existing team so that you get the customized solutions, C-Level expertise, and proven process you need. It‚Äôs a model designed around our belief that ‚Äúyour success is our success,‚Äù and we are uncommonly committed to your success. Schedule a free consultation with our team today and stop wasting time and money on ineffective tactics and start growing your business with confidence and competence: info@yorcmo.com | www.yorcmo.com

summary: My journey's been quite a ride: from an Army brat to Military Police, then a police officer, paramedic, Navy spouse, and a business owner for 30 years. All those experiences gave me a unique lens for navigating life's big challenges. And my military dad? He taught me that your word is everything, period. That's always been my North Star. Then came the moment that changed everything. After my husband, Jim, passed away, I found myself in a really vulnerable spot, something I never expected despite my business success. That feeling was a huge wake-up call. I just refused to let anyone else go through that, so I dug in and mastered how to build lasting stability and well-being. My friends say I'm stubborn about everything, and hey, they're not wrong! For over 20 years, I've had the incredible privilege of helping hundreds of families and thousands of folks become their most resilient selves. My passion is empowering the people who truly keep our country going‚Äîveterans, folks in rural America, farmers, truckers, and entrepreneurs. I love taking complicated stuff and making it simple, helping people really step into their power. My approach is pretty straightforward: think strategically, make smart choices, and use what you've got effectively. My biggest tip? Consistent, focused effort really does pay off big time in the long run. With six generations of military service in my family, helping those who've served is deeply personal for me. And living out here in rural America, I'm constantly working to help our communities find their footing and build a strong future, generation after generation. You know that saying, "you are who you spend time with"? That totally changed how I connect with people. I love bringing clients, experts, and executives together because I really get what makes them tick‚Äîtheir challenges, their dreams, all of it. When I'm not busy helping people create brighter futures, you'll find me on my farm, training horses and dogs. Oh, and get this: at 60, I'm on zero meds and can deadlift almost 300 pounds! It just goes to show you that the same rules apply whether you're building a strong life or a strong body: ditch what doesn't serve you, stay consistent, and nail the basics. That... is the new art of living.

summary: Maya Hu-Chan is an award-winning keynote speaker, Top executive coach, best selling author and leadership educator. She is the founder and president of Global Leadership Associates, an international management consulting firm in San Diego, California. Maya has built a reputation for excellence in global leadership, cross-cultural management, diversity, equity and inclusion. Maya's latest book "Saving Face: How to Preserve Dignity and Build Trust" is Amazon #1 Best Seller (2020 Berrett-Koehler). Her book ‚ÄúGlobal Leadership: The Next Generation‚Äù was chosen by Harvard Business School's Working Knowledge book. She is a contributing author of 14 business books, and columnist for INC.com. Maya was ranked Top Leadership Coaches (2021-22), Top Global Solutions Thinkers by Thinkers50, World's Top 30 Leadership Gurus, Top 100 Thought Leaders in Management & Leadership, Marquis Who's Who in America 2025, and member of Marshall Goldsmith's 100 Coaches. Her charismatic and engaging style has made her a regular keynote speaker. She has lectured at The Brookings Institution, the University of Southern California, Penn State University, The University of Chicago, Dartmouth College and the University of California, San Diego. Born and raised in Taiwan, Maya received her BA in journalism and business from National Chengchi University. She was an anchor for the China Broadcasting Company, then moved to the U.S. to earn a MA from The University of Pennsylvania‚Äôs Annenberg School for Communication. She served as the CEO of a non-profit organization in San Diego before embarking on her consulting career. She lives in San Diego, California, with her husband and three children. education school linkedin description (3: Known as ‚ÄúThe JC‚Äù, New Mexico Junior College was the first junior college founded in New Mexico after the legislature in Santa Fe passed the 1963 Junior College Act. Established in 1965, the college first opened its doors to students in the fall of 1966. Since that time, the JC has become a leader in innovative educational programs, dual credit education for area high school students, industrial and professional workforce training, and a critical player in the economy of the region. Situated on 219 acres, the college has over 637,000 gross square feet of building space with an enrollment of about 3,000 students. Students can receive an Associates of Arts, and Associates of Science, and an Associates of Applied Science, with an emphasis in several fields, plus we offer occupational certificate programs that provide a course of study preparing students directly for employment or self-employment upon completion of the program. Long a leader in dual credit education, well before the term was widely recognized, NMJC and area high schools have evolved a best practice model of dual credit and on campus career technical training courses that regularly results in high school seniors walking for their high school diploma and two-year degree in the same week. As an early adopter of distance education technology, NMJC provides a wide range of educational opportunities to students throughout the region and nation. Roughly one-third of NMJC student credit hours are produced in an online-learning environment. In workforce training and professional development, The JC provided more workforce training in 2014 for area residents and businesses than any other community college in New Mexico, despite the fact that its rural area is significantly smaller than the large metropolitan areas of the state. NMJC is a national leader in energy education and training. Serving an area of the country known as the Permian Basin, The JC has developed one of the first comprehensive oil field training facilities in the nation. In addition, the recent expansion of the nuclear industry in the region has driven development of a robust online training program for nuclear technicians. With support from the Nuclear Regulatory Commission and Lockheed Martin, The JC has become the college-of-choice for technical training in the nuclear industry. Annually, students in the nursing program at NMJC are ranked in the top ten percent of all nursing students in the nation, based on their national testing scores. The NMJC Law Enforcement Academy has been ranked one of the premiere academies in the state. Its instructors are in demand to help police departments throughout New Mexico with updated training for their forces. The NMJC Foundation has awarded over $2.5 million in scholarships and work-study assistance to NMJC students. Another $560,000 has funded program support for students and faculty. The foundation manages over 75 different endowments, annual scholarships and program assistance funds totaling over $8 million. New Mexico Junior College is one of the few community colleges in New Mexico with athletic programs. Student-athletes typically maintain high GPAs while competing. All six of the athletic programs earned post-season berths in either regional or national competitions. NMJC is a full-service institution with student housing, athletics and an aggressive range of traditional, transfer educational offerings. The University Center houses four-year and graduate programs allowing students to move from Day One of their college experience through Bachelors and Masters level programs without leaving campus.

summary: Once you realize that working with a coach elevates your game, you‚Äôll ask yourself what kept you from getting started sooner. Executive leaders in global organizations work with me because they know that by identifying, addressing, and minimizing the Culture Gap they get better at what they do. International frustration slows, their business growths, success shows. Ready to talk? üì© GetStarted@TheCultureMastery.com German by birth, American by choice, and Bavarian at heart, I am a fan of building bridges - across cultures - and not enthusiastic about walls. My clients know that "soft skills" are, in fact, hard. They come to us because they want to develop their ACE-Q (=AQ+CQ+EQ). I am a coach to executive global leaders and a cross-cultural consultant. People book me as a keynote speaker for international events. I am an experienced program facilitator, certified to work with the GlobeSmart Profile, the Inclusive Behaviors Inventory, the AQai assessment, and the CodeBreaker.BANKcode personality profile. I am also an NLP Master trainer. With my team at The Culture Mastery I help leaders close cultural gaps. Does your organization always meet its global growth goals? Without a solid foundation of cultural competence companies leave money on the table of international business. For more than a decade our clients have experienced measurable improvements and outrank their competition when it comes to structuring, leading, and communicating across cultures. I am a strong believer that any conflict can be resolved with a better understanding of our cultures. And as a German, burdened with the inherited guilt of the most horrific crime against humanity, it is my duty and moral obligation to make our world a more peaceful, responsible place. Our cultural training and coaching programs can be designed specifically for business leaders and thought leaders, as well as peace makers and rule makers. At The Culture Mastery we help people to work better together across cultures. When companies work internationally, their employees need to be effective in collaborating with people from cultures which are foreign to them. They need to be able to sell and market to customers with unfamiliar consumption preferences. Failing to communicate, manage, inspire, and lead across cultural differences is a huge risk for these companies, and the lack of cultural competence can be a bottom-line relevant issue.
job description: Work. Together. Across Cultures. The Culture Mastery is a boutique training, coaching, and mentoring firm for global leaders who want to succeed in working across cultures. Our mission is to lead individuals and organizations to a better understanding of their own culture and those cultures they interact with, so they can work at their peak and in peace with each other, through teaching, training and coaching. Our vision is for a more peaceful world and we accomplish this by helping people from different cultures understand each other better. We don‚Äôt deliver training & development widgets; we help you attain a higher level of cultural awareness and competence. By mastering cultural transitions, you will be at peak performance in the global community. At The Culture Mastery, all team members have crossed cultures at least once in their lives. We serve the global business community with four main services: ‚Ä¢ Cultural Training & Coaching: In an international context, smart business decisions depend on the ability to bridge cultural differences. Team members need to be able to understand these differences and how to work across cultures. ‚Ä¢ Global Leadership Development: As leaders grow into their international roles, the skills which got them into their position will not be the same skills which will propel their global career. Smart executives learn how to lead in a global context. ‚Ä¢ Expat Services: When international employees take on assignments abroad, the challenges of relocation can make or break the project. Our Destination Services ease the pain of the mundane. ‚Ä¢ Language Support: Your global business can easily get lost in translation. While you master the culture, you don‚Äôt want to neglect your company‚Äôs language skills. Masterful communication is critical for global success.
linkedin description: The Culture Mastery is a boutique consulting firm addressing the diverse needs of customers who are doing business across cultures and borders. Our clients trust us and rely on us that we lead their employees and their teams to more success across national and cultural borders. We assist in improving business success by providing a variety of services which are targeted at and tailored to increasing productivity when entering new international markets. When companies work internationally and expand outside of their home markets, their employees need to be effective in collaborating with people from cultures which are foreign to them. They need to be able to sell and market to customers with unfamiliar consumption preferences. Beyond language barriers global professionals are confronted with different behaviors and ways of doing business. Failing to communicate, manage, inspire, and lead across cultural differences is a huge risk for these companies, and the lack of cultural competence can be a bottom-line relevant issue. We help multinational organizations and their employees to work better together across cultures. In an international context, smart business decisions depend on the ability to bridge cultural differences. Employees on every level of the organization need to be able to understand these differences and how to work across cultures. When global leaders fail to adjust and to operate in light of cultural differences, international projects are at risk: Companies lose business due to miscommunication and miss out on international growth opportunities. The central goal of leadership development and cross-cultural learning initiatives by TCM is to establish and develop cross-cultural and leadership competence for your leaders and team members by creating a structured awareness of the impact of culture on all business functions and communications.

summary: Over the years, I‚Äôve learned that the decisions we make as leaders ripple far beyond the boardroom. They shape careers, cultures, and communities... and, perhaps most importantly, they set an example for the people watching us most closely ‚Äî at work, and at home. I‚Äôve worn many hats: CEO, operating executive, advisor, dealmaker, coach, and podcast host. I‚Äôve led sales from $400 million to over $1 billion in an organic growth cycle, delivered 4x growth in six years, navigated more than a dozen acquisitions, and opened new markets. I‚Äôve worked in public companies, private equity-backed businesses, and family-owned enterprises in the middle of steep growth curves. The scale changes, but the through-line is always the same: connect great people, align them around a shared purpose, and give them the space to do their best work. That belief fuels my work at LEAD3R and as host of The Future of Teamwork Podcast, where I‚Äôve interviewed more than 150 leaders from every corner of the working world. Each conversation is a masterclass in leadership - part learning, part teaching, always a reminder that kindness and clarity are not mutually exclusive in high performance. These dialogues sharpen my own leadership style, helping me find new ways to guide teams that are both values-driven and results-focused. I‚Äôm endlessly fascinated by the changing shape of tomorrow‚Äôs workplace - how technology, community, and business can intersect to tackle big challenges like diversity and inclusion, skills transfer, innovation, and disruption. It‚Äôs a space where curiosity is an asset, and collaboration is both art and science. At this point in my career, I know two things for certain: great teams don‚Äôt happen by accident, and leadership is a privilege that comes with a responsibility to use it well. If you‚Äôre as interested in building purposeful teams and unlocking the potential of people as I am, I‚Äôd be glad to connect.
job description: At LEAD3R, we believe in advancing all people through business, and business through all people. We achieve this by elevating the chemistry, capacity, and capability of great teams. Our approach is to co-design individual, team, and organizational effectiveness solutions, ensuring continuous progress ‚Äì no matter what stage of the journey you are at.
linkedin description: Healthy Teams. Healthy Results. We are dedicated to helping leaders activate the full potential of their people by strengthening team dynamics, deepening engagement, and elevating team health across one million teams. LEAD3R transforms organizations through Team Effectiveness consulting, Executive Coaching, Interim and Fractional Talent, and Executive Search & Talent Intelligence. Our curiosity-driven approach and deep expertise in how teams truly work unleashes performance, resilience, and belonging. Your biggest breakthroughs happen when your teams are healthy. Let‚Äôs build them together.

summary: If you are a CEO, entrepreneur or business owner pursuing mergers or acquisitions as part of your growth strategy, let‚Äôs talk. There‚Äôs a reason CEO's call me an "M&A Whisperer". The title comes from my work advising leaders and organizations on the "unexpected people challenges" of Mergers & Acquisitions. The challenges that can doom a deal but which rarely get covered in M&A preparedness training. I've been on all sides of the deal equation and show leaders what it takes to lead people through change and uncertainty. My leadership lessons came as an international C-Suite executive leading teams through three separate multibillion-dollar deals. I learned firsthand that M&A growth strategies suffer when leaders haven‚Äôt been prepared to guide their teams through the emotional roller-coaster that can occur post-deal. No wonder people struggle to pivot and adapt as quickly as management expects. These insights and lessons were captured in my best-selling M&A business book, "NOW WHAT? A Survivor‚Äôs Guide for Thriving Through Mergers & Acquisitions" which serves as a playbook for executives and handbook for frontline leaders balancing their day job with post-deal integration work. My M&A consultancy, Day1 Ready was founded on the premise that M is for Mindset and A is for Agile. Through one-day workshops and keynotes, I‚Äôve prepared hundreds of CEOs, executives and middle managers to recognize that success in M&A is not solely achieved by following static playbooks; success comes from having an adaptive mindset and an agile approach. Speaking on human capital strategies that drive M&A success, I‚Äôve guest lectured at the University of Chicago/Booth School of Business, Northwestern, and Thunderbird School of Global Management. I write a business leadership column for Forbes and contribute to Harvard Business Review, Fast Company, and Inc. Honored as Entrepreneur of the Year by Northshore Women in Business in 2019, I was recently ranked the #1 M&A Leadership Consultant by Leadership Research Institute and nominated to Thinkers50 2024 Radar list of future management thinkers to watch. Expertise: transition strategist; integration planning and execution; culture assimilation; change management; change communications; M&A on-boarding/off-boarding; brand identity and strategy; B2B marketing and communications Pursuing an M&A deal? Reach out to see how I might support you: Jennifer@jenniferjfondrevay.com
job title: Founder, Day1 Ready LLC ‚ñ∫ M&A Integration Consultant ‚ñ∫ Transition Strategist ‚ñ∫ Change Management
job description: Whether working with entrepreneurs, small/mid-market businesses or Fortune 500 companies, I have seen countless growth strategies fall short because a workforce could not adapt to the changes as quickly as leadership anticipated. In hindsight, it‚Äôs easy to see why people strategies broke down, but by then it‚Äôs too late to intervene. When your workforce is not delivering it can be tough to stop the downward spiral. I guide companies and their employees through unfamiliar waters so that companies never reach that point. As Founder of Day 1 Ready Consultancy, I serve as the transition advisor to senior leadership, ensuring the people component of a company‚Äôs plan, such as leadership alignment, culture assimilation, employee engagement, productivity and retention are an early focus of the deal to ensure success. From senior executives to frontline leaders/ middle managers, I coach them through the transition to be a successful contributor to the company‚Äôs future and to keep the business growth strategies on track. If you want to get your workforce bought in and onboard, retain your top talent, and maintain productivity post-deal, PLEASE reach out: ‚úâ jennifer@jenniferjfondrevaycom ‚òè 312-608-9939 ‚ñ∫ www.jenniferjfondrevay.com

In hindsight, it‚Äôs easy to see why people strategies broke down, but by then it‚Äôs too late to intervene. job description (2): From a leadership change to a company restructure to digital transformation, business transitions have key challenges in common -- they bring waves of change and uncertainty upon the workforce. Mergers and acquisitions tend to have the greatest challenges due to the drive to integrate people, processes and systems as quickly as possible to achieve the valuation. In her keynotes and workshops, Jennifer shows how understanding the people piece to M&A integration and change management can be a companies competitive advantage post-deal. summary: I'm not an exit consultant. I help owners build businesses they never want to sell. (Ironically, that's exactly when buyers pay the most.) Most 'succession advisors' are former brokers who've never written a check. I've written millions in checks. ‚úÖ Bought businesses with my own money and advised buyers and sellers in over $250 million worth of small business deals. ‚úÖ Learned how to systematize and grow businesses to not depend on their owners to operate (on my own dime!) ‚úÖ Sold businesses to strategic buyers ‚úÖ Structured management buyouts that actually worked ‚úÖ Helped owners pass to family without destroying relationships ‚úÖ Come from a real-world, dirty fingernails, operational background, not a consultant who only knows spreadsheets. I've sat in every chair at the closing table. That's the difference. ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ THE UNCOMFORTABLE TRUTH: Your business is probably unsellable right now. - You're irreplaceable (buyers run from this) - Your financials tell three different stories - Your team would quit if you left tomorrow - You have no idea what you're actually worth But here's what most owners don't know: The changes that make your business sellable also make it more profitable TODAY. That's why smart owners start succession preparation years before they need it. Not to sell. But to have the OPTION to sell. ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ WHERE ARE YOU? üî¥ TRAPPED: "I can't take a real vacation without chaos" ‚Üí We build systems so the business runs without you üü° GROWING: "I need to scale but organic growth is too slow" ‚Üí We acquire competitors or expand strategically üü¢ PREPARING: "I want options but don't know where to start" ‚Üí We create your succession roadmap (family, management, or sale) ‚ö™ READY: "It's time. Get me the best outcome possible" ‚Üí We run a process that adds 30-50% to your value ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ THE BOTTOM LINE: I don't push anyone toward a sale. That's what brokers do. I help you build a business with options: - Option to run it forever (profitably) - Option to pass to family (smoothly) - Option to sell to management / employees (fairly) - Option to sell to a strategic (lucratively) No options = prison. summary: The founder makes the difference. Same idea, same market, similar traction‚Äîinvestors bet on the founder who can navigate extreme uncertainty without getting lost in the sauce. This is not trivial. Your job is hard. You're searching for a business model in a particular market that's never been built before, making strategic decisions without clear answers, designing a future company while staying grounded in present reality.Doing this competently requires a specific skillset that most people have never developed. It's about developing the capabilities to search systematically, design strategically, and make grounded decisions when there's no obvious path forward.I have been a founder performance coach for 11 years. I work with pre-seed through Series A founders who are playing the long game, building companies that matter. I help you develop those skills‚Äîusing a venture design framework that gives you structure for the search, context for prioritization, and confidence in your decisions.
job description: KeyChange is a venture design practice that helps purpose-driven startup founders build well-designed companies that create lasting impact. We specialize in working with "Visionary Way" founders‚Äîthose committed to elevating standards and playing the long game rather than seeking quick exits. Through our Venture Design Framework and founder performance coaching, we help early-stage teams gain clarity on their biggest risks, develop competence in startup fundamentals, and build confidence in their unique approach. We provide the tools, strategy, and systematic support founders need to find product-market fit while staying true to their mission. KeyChange exists because we believe the founders who care deeply about what they're building and how they build it should be the ones who win. We're here to make sure they have every advantage possible.

linkedin description (2): At Seed Round Capital, we believe that running a startup should be fun and profitable. We understand where you are because we've been there too, which is why we formed Seed Round Capital, offering early-stage funding and fundraising support to help you turn your startup into the thriving company you envisioned when you began. Most tech company founders fail on their way to Series A funding because of poor decision-making and lack of direction. They may not even realize some of the mistakes they are making. Seed Round Capital‚Äôs personalized guidance provides expert advising so startups can raise the money they need, enjoy their journeys, and see exponential growth. As an early-stage startup founder you're likely overwhelmed by concerns about running out of money, letting people down and losing your dream. You need cash and customers and can only survive without both of these for so long. Having a great product, some paying customers and working hard have gotten you to this point, but you know you need to take a more formal approach to increase your chances of raising money and being successful. As a startup, it can be very difficult to find the training, funding and support you need to succeed as a business, making you wonder why you even started the business in the first place. At Seed Round Capital we can provide that support you need to become the successful tech company CEO you aspire to be.

summary: I help CEOs and executives move from being ‚Äúoperators who get things done‚Äù to being ‚Äúleaders who create advantage and lasting impact.‚Äù Who are you? Mid-level and senior executives who‚Äôve been told they ‚Äúneed to be more strategic.‚Äù Leaders who are strong operators but struggle to make the shift into strategic roles. Organizations that want their managers at all levels to think and act more strategically, not just execute. New CEOs and executives inheriting entrenched strategies who need to reshape thinking across their teams. 2. What keeps you up at night? Fear of being seen as ‚Äúnot strategic enough‚Äù and getting sidelined or even laid off. Overloaded agendas where everything feels urgent but little feels truly strategic. Frustration with plans that don‚Äôt move the organization forward‚Äîlots of initiatives, little impact. The weight of uncertainty and complexity‚Äînoise, turbulence, and competing priorities. Worry about losing influence, missing opportunities, or being blindsided by disruption. 3. What have you tried? Reading strategy books or attending planning-heavy courses that explain what strategy is but not how to be strategic. Creating long lists of initiatives and cascading them down through the org chart‚Äîonly to produce confusion and traffic jams. Traditional ‚Äústrategic planning‚Äù that focuses on budgets and targets instead of shaping thinking and decisions. Leaning on OKRs or similar tools that masquerade as strategy but don‚Äôt shift behavior or perspective. 4. The transformation you need? To be recognized as true strategic thinkers‚Äînot just operators who execute. To shift from reactive, tactical fire-fighting to enactive, purpose-driven leadership. To see complexity more clearly, prioritize effectively, and focus on leverage points for real impact. To gain influence in their organizations by connecting their work directly to strategy. To build confidence that they can navigate uncertainty and shape the future rather than just respond to it. How I Can Help: ‚ñ∂ CEO Coaching: Personalized coaching for CEOs and Business Unit leaders of 8+ figure businesses, designed to build robust systems for success. ‚ñ∂ Consulting: Strategy and consulting services for Fortune 500-1000 companies, including strategy development, digital transformation, M&A support, and performance improvement initiatives. ‚ñ∂ Online Training Programs: üí° Strategic Thinking For Advantage: A program for aspiring executives to sharpen their strategic skills. üèÜ Win Your Day: An online course sharing my productivity system to help you become more effective.

summary: Independent Strategy Advisor | Emerging Tech & Science Organizations ‚òè (301) 442-5889 ‚úâ mark@haasstrategy.com https://haasstrategy.com I help executives and boards of mission-focused and science-driven organizations make confident choices in environments of uncertainty and change. As Founder of Haas Strategy Solutions, I bring more than 40 years of management consulting experience across nonprofits, professional services, manufacturing, healthcare, defense, and emerging technology. My work complements internal planning by offering independent perspective, structured strategy processes, and an ethics lens that ensures decisions are resilient as well as ambitious. My career began in ecology and systems modeling, then expanded into public policy and decades of advising leaders at the National Institutes of Health, the U.S. Navy‚Äôs Office of Naval Research, international science programs, and economic development institutions such as the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development. Across these roles, I learned that organizations succeed or falter not only on technical brilliance, but on how well they align strategy, ecosystems, and ethics. That philosophy drives Haas Strategy Solutions today. My services focus on three core offerings: ‚Ä¢ Strategy Red Team ‚Äî an independent second opinion that surfaces blind spots, challenges assumptions, and tests resilience before major commitments are made. ‚Ä¢ Strategy Foundation ‚Äî a diagnostic and design process that clarifies mission, business model, and performance systems, giving leaders a stronger base for growth. ‚Ä¢ Strategy Stress Test ‚Äî scenario-based evaluation of resilience under disruption, whether from technology, regulation, competition, or economic shocks. I also advise organizations working at the frontier of emerging technology‚Äîincluding AI, quantum computing, biotech, defense, energy, and advanced manufacturing. I help translate technical roadmaps into organizational clarity: mapping ecosystems, planning for scarce talent, designing commercialization pathways, and embedding ethics and governance as strategic differentiators. For 20 years, I also served as an ethics officer, which taught me that foresight and trust are not optional. In fields from personalized medicine to AI, ignoring ethics until too late has slowed adoption and triggered regulation. By contrast, organizations that anticipate these issues build legitimacy faster and endure longer.
job description: Haas Strategy Solutions empowers midmarket executives and boards to navigate strategic challenges and enhance performance. summary: With my background of owning companies for over 35-years as well as investing in and selling business I have owned I have learned great lessons as a CPA, CFO and CEO. This firm was created to leverage my prior experience to assist business owners as a long-term trusted advisor in the business financial arena. My passion is coaching business leaders to grow revenue, margin, profit, cash flow and ultimately the value of their companies. Whether this is for a 120-year-old multi-generational family legacy company or a startup with a great idea and in need of capital, I serve the gap between the owners, CEO and finance team. I have expertise in growing companies, preparing them for a sale transition and walking them through the process of the sale. I also provide guidance with obtaining capital and optimal debt structure. During my career I have worked with hundreds of business enterprises and provided counsel to buyers and sellers of companies to maximize the value and resulting after tax cash. My passion in working with business owners has been the culmination of preparing the business for sale and successfully transitioning the ownership, with the rewards optimized for the seller. Exit Planning strategy and M&A execution are also areas of my expertise. I bring my experience in board rooms as an active and engaged board member for a select group of companies.

summary: Leadership wasn‚Äôt built for a people-first focus. It‚Äôs time to re-engineer it. I help executives and organizations transform empathy from being seen as a ‚Äúsoft skill‚Äù into a strategic leadership advantage. Using my ROE (Return on Empathy) framework, I turn Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) into Key People Indicators ‚Äì strengthening trust, accelerating decision-making, and improving business outcomes. The truth is, organizations rarely fail for lack of strategy; they struggle because people don‚Äôt feel safe, seen, or supported. Most leaders default to ME-pathy (‚Äúunderstand me, my intent, my stress‚Äù) without realizing it. True EM-pathy (‚Äúlet me understand you first‚Äù) drives psychological safety, retention, engagement, and innovation. My Mission To prove, with data and lived experience, that ROE is the new ROI. My Journey & Expertise I began life with a lesson in belonging -- adopted at three weeks old by parents who taught me worthiness, compassion, and unconditional love. Then came male-saturated industries where those traits weren‚Äôt always valued. I watched brilliant people burn out, values get compromised, and leaders rewarded for bureaucracy over bravery. I led that way once, too ‚Ä¶ until it backfired. My breakdown became my breakthrough. What I Offer EQ Assessment + Debrief A science-backed evaluation of baseline emotional intelligence across four key areas-Self-Awareness, Self-Management, Social Awareness & Relationship Management culminating in a personalized EQ Call to ACTion that becomes each leader‚Äôs roadmap for growth. Culture Consulting (ROE Framework) My signature Return on Empathy (ROE) methodology transforms organizational culture by shifting leaders from ME-pathy to EM-pathy, strengthening psychological safety, trust and communication across all levels within your organization. Keynotes That Create a Bias for Action Dynamic, evidenced-base talks on EQ, empathy, psychological safety and trust‚Äîshowing leaders how to make People FIRST = Performance ALWAYS. Track Record - Creator of the ROE (Return on Empathy) model and International Best Selling Author - Global keynote speaker on empathy, EQ psychological safety (U.S., Africa, Europe, SE Asia) - 25+ years leading teams in engineering, construction & high-risk government projects - Leading organizations from accidental to intentional cultures, rooted in their values and aligned with their vision. - Sparring partner for leaders across STEM, Operations and Federal Government Ready to turn empathy into your next strategic advantage? Book a call üìû with me today!

summary: After more than 25 years as a clinical psychologist and international consultant, I founded the DILAN Consulting Group to help channel my passion for people and business. Our work is grounded in the simple and yet profound belief that, "Business is Human¬Æ". As a team of mostly psychologists, we are experts at understanding and shaping behavior. Over the course of my career, I have demonstrated a unique ability to connect with demanding personalities, manage the toughest conflicts, and architect organizational development strategies that create winning cultures that consistently drive optimal performance. My experience includes helping to transform a diverse range of organizations, including Fortune 500 firms, non-profits, and start-ups in technology, biotech, energy, defense, aerospace, and more. Professional Highlights: ‚Ä¢ Dynamic, dedicated, and results-driven psychologist with over 25 years of experience combining organizational development and clinical psychology to help optimize organizational performance. ‚Ä¢ Proven ability to design and deliver high-performing programs that help global organizations, teams, and leaders negotiate difficult challenges in high stakes situations and environments including in Afghanistan and Iraq. ‚Ä¢ Demonstrated ability to influence stakeholders, lead large teams, design and deliver programs that surpass expectations on time and within budget. ‚Ä¢ Hands on management experience managing budgets up to $6 million and leading teams of more than 50 people. ‚Ä¢ Polished and powerful presenter. Personable, articulate, and persuasive. ‚Ä¢ Bilingual (Native English and Native Spanish) and bi-cultural. Specialties include: Employee Engagement, Leadership Development, Strategic Planning, Change Management, Diversity & Inclusion, Team Building, Conflict Management, Organizational Culture, Executive Coaching, Employee Assessment, Labor Relations, Mergers and Acquisitions, Process Facilitation, Focus Groups, and Adult Learning.

Presently, we have three programs: Science in the City - A weeklong day camp at Stanford University that teaches 50 minority 5th and 6th graders, math, chemistry, physics, and engineering; TSEP Overnight Camping Conference - a weekend long camp at Camp Loma Mar (owned and operated by the YMCA of the East Bay) that teaches 120 minority high school students from all over Northern California about the engineering behind various tech companies'‚Äã products and services; and Family Science Nights - Evening programs hosted by tech companies that introduce minority students and their siblings to the tech they create and their parents to supportive tools to further their children's STEM education. For more information, please visit http://www.TheSocialEngineer.org

job description: Imagine building a business where your systems work harder than you do. That‚Äôs what I‚Äôve done ‚Äî and now, I help others do the same. I‚Äôm Tina Servis, founder of Maid 4 Time, a 7-figure cleaning referral company built on a lean, smart model using independent contractors. From scrubbing floors to scaling operations, I‚Äôve lived the journey ‚Äî and cracked the code on sustainable growth. But my story didn‚Äôt stop there. I launched Lead Titan, a marketing and automation agency that helps home service businesses grow 35‚Äì50% year-over-year. How? By blending strategic thinking, systems design, and deep operational insight. As a Fractional COO, I step into businesses like yours to rewire outdated models and spark results you didn‚Äôt think possible. I wonder what would happen if your business ran like a machine ‚Äî not a maze. Other people have already shifted from stress to scaling. What if you‚Äôre next? Whether I‚Äôm examining your margins, trimming costs of goods sold, or mapping automation workflows, my goal is always the same: Help you think differently. Grow smarter. Lead better. I‚Äôm on a mission to elevate service-based businesses ‚Äî and I believe yours could be next. Let‚Äôs make it happen.

We‚Äôre here for athletes who don‚Äôt back down when the weather turns or the grind gets tough. From indoor sweat sessions to snow-covered base miles, Canadian endurance athletes are built different. We don‚Äôt wait for the perfect conditions, we create them. We chase progress through the long winter, pushing through frozen roads or hammering intervals on the trainer. Mauna Canada exists to serve that spirit, with custom kits that perform under pressure, and a global gear collection that delivers world-class quality, shipped directly from within Canada. education school linkedin description (1: Technology is who we are ‚Äî it‚Äôs what we do. Officially known as the Southern Alberta Institute of Technology (SAIT), we‚Äôre a community of thinkers, creators and champions leading change and reimagining the workforce of tomorrow. In 1916, our doors opened in Calgary, Alberta, Canada with 11 students and a mandate to train veterans returning from the First World War. Over the years, we‚Äôve matched community needs ‚Äî as a hospital during the Spanish Flu pandemic and as a Royal Canadian Air Force Wireless Training School during the Second World War. Fast forward to today and SAIT‚Äôs action-based learning, solution-focused research and industry partnerships are helping to shape the next generation of inventors, entrepreneurs and pioneers. - We equip students with essential skills for career success in industry. 91% of our grads get hired and 97% recommend a SAIT education. - Whether looking to upskill or change careers, we enable lifetime learning through relevant, customized education. - We enhance the global competitiveness of our students and region. - With more than 11,000 industry partners, we blur the lines between industry and SAIT to strengthen the economy.

summary: I am a Certified Management Consultant (CMC) with a can-do approach to business. I am passionate about designing, delivering, and implementing innovative and practical business strategies by combining my in-depth knowledge, experience, and expertise in a variety of functional areas of business. I am passionate about business strategy, and have a keen understanding of working with for profit, non-profit, and co-operative organizations of all sizes in a variety of industries, including retail, tourism, hospitality, manufacturing, and professional services. I also have extensive experience in working with First Nations communities as a consultant on economic development and empowerment initiatives in a variety of geographical regions and with a variety of business models, including co-operatives. I am also a Certified Customer Experience Professional (CCXP), a Certified Sales Professional (CSP), and a Certified Exit Planning Advisor (CEPA), and bring an innovative and creative approach to developing customer and employee experience, sales and service strategies, and engaging others to establish recommendations for business development and other business activities that add and sustain value. My consulting practices are complemented by the ISO 20700:2017 guidelines for the effective delivery of management consultancy services. My experience and expertise in customer experience helps organizations solve their challenges by seeing things from their customers' perspective. I have worked with clients in a variety of industries to develop strategy, enhance brand awareness, generate leads, support sales teams, and grow their business. My strengths are building trust by listening to and connecting with people to quickly address their needs, and collaborating with them to visualize solutions that are focused on defining, achieving, and enhancing their strategic objectives. My career has been well balanced among management consulting, strategic planning, marketing strategy, project management, B2B and B2C sales, business development and entrepreneurial management, with a particular emphasis on building, nurturing, and sustaining client relationships. Living by the mantra of well done is better than well said, I emphasize the successful implementation and execution of initiatives that make a positive and sustainable difference by being on target, on time, and on budget. My experience is complemented with exceptional business acumen, entrepreneurial spirit, and proven success in communicating, executing and monitoring strategic business initiatives.

Steeped in academic excellence, with a distinguished faculty and a corps of over 36,000 successful alumni. At Rutgers University‚ÄìNewark, we are leaders in business education keenly attuned to America‚Äôs and the world‚Äôs metropolitan future, including vibrant specialized graduate programs that impel growth and create social impact by our strong public, private, and community partnerships. Rutgers Business School offers bachelor's, master's, and Ph.D. degrees including highly ranked Executive, Full-Time & Part-Time MBA programs, a 14-month MBA in Professional Accounting and masters degrees in Accounting, Quantitative Finance, Financial Analysis, Information Technology, Business of Fashion, Supply Chain Management and Healthcare.

summary: Serves as a catalyst to move leadership teams toward overcoming cycles of disappointment re: unrealized growth and transformation projects that don‚Äôt deliver. The keys to sustainable success lie in objective examination of the mindset, decision making, culture, and measures of success that you think are working, but are holding you back from achieving your goals. Don‚Äôt celebrate an ‚ÄúROI‚Äù where you‚Äôve simply completed a project or covered project expenses‚Ä¶you are a leader(!); your growth metric is about changing the trajectory of growth‚Ä¶period. That‚Äôs the ‚ÄúDelta‚Äù that matters. Finally, Todd helps companies stop the inward focus of the Human Resources function, linear thinking about change, and ignoring growth limiting habits just to chase the next new thing. Execution matters! Drives adoption of innovative and evidence-based practices in leading change, coaching key leaders, and distilling the best leadership guidance into practical, easy-to-adopt keys to unlocking performance. Uses data and strategic insight to help leadership teams see into gaps which slow growth or result in change failures. Todd has been awarded the only U.S. Patent for Leading Indicators of Change Management Success, and brought Agile Leadership Team profiles to market. summary: As founder of MBM Coaching & Consulting, my mission is to facilitate growth, development, and positive changes in individuals, company leaders, their teams, and organizations in order to drive their success. Throughout my career I have served more than 500 leaders in 150 organizations, from Fortune 500 companies to small to medium-sized businesses. What sets me apart is my high-impact coaching style which balances trust and empathy with practical and powerful strategies that elevate self-awareness, spark insights, and inspire change. Using real-time issues to make learning highly actionable, I help leaders be more intentional, change agile, and effective in adapting their capabilities for new roles or changing circumstances. MBM Coaching & Consulting provides leaders and their organizations the following services: For organizations: ‚Ä¢ Executive coaching for senior and strategic leaders ‚Ä¢ Leadership coaching for leadership growth, development, and transition ‚Ä¢ Development coaching for emerging and high potential leaders ‚Ä¢ Onboarding coaching for new executive leaders ‚Ä¢ Team coaching for new or existing leadership and project-based teams ‚Ä¢ Outplacement coaching and workshops for separating employees For individuals ‚Ä¢ Leadership coaching for experienced, emerging, and newly hired leaders ‚Ä¢ Career coaching, exploration, and transition for individuals wanting to launch or change direction Just a few of MBM Coaching & Consulting‚Äôs success stories include: ‚Ä¢ Shifting a leader‚Äôs approach from command and control to a catalyst leadership style, which in turn produced the highest employee engagement survey results in the company‚Äôs history ‚Ä¢ Continuously coaching a high potential leader that would result in a promotion to Vice President ‚Ä¢ Developing an in-depth team coaching process that led to a significant increase in collaboration with positive business impact I invite you to explore how we could partner to address your leadership challenges and journey. Find out more about my work at mbmcoachconsult.com and connect with me via email marla@mbmcoachconsult.com or phone 610.390.1773.

summary: I invite evolution. First for myself. For over 15 years, I have been supporting leadership and organizational development towards systems change, providing coaching, consultation, and facilitation around inner development, organizational alignment, strategic learning and evaluation, and policy/advocacy strategy development. I have worked internationally and domestically, with front-line staff to executives from nonprofits, philanthropy, healthcare organizations, collective impact initiatives, and educational institutions. I serve at the intersection of the multitude of our humanity and the complexity of our systems. I am grounded in the premise that systems change often happens through the personal transformation of its members. I am passionate about supporting greater insight, awareness, clarity, purpose, alignment, and courage for individuals and organizations. Attuned to personality patterns that make us uniquely human and cultural patterns that make us humankind, I am curious about eliciting the implicit value orientations that guide our attention, thinking and behavior. I am committed to examining systemic conditions while exploring new mindsets, power dynamics, and relationships to bring about a new reality. One of my great joys is to ask questions and hold space for discovery.
job description: We foster transformative change within people, organizations, and systems through coaching, strategy, and facilitation. We offer services for 1) Inner development & leadership support 2) Organizational development and alignment 3) Building cultures, practices, and tools for strategic learning & evaluation, 4) Developing strategies for advocacy, policy agendas, and systems shifts. Woven throughout these offerings is an emphasis on cultivating well-being and discovery. We seek to create conditions and engage in processes that deepen our awareness, strengthen our interconnectivity, heighten our clarity, intrigue our purpose, explore our alignment, and spur us to step forward with courage. We aim for our work to be both strategic and transformative. We hold space for reflective inquiry and relationship. We support change at both the individual, organizational, and systems level. We do our work as coaches, thought partners, analysts, strategists, facilitators, systems conveners, connectors, learners, community members, and partners. Some reasons we might work together include: *You want to connect with an experienced leader and thought partner around the complexity of leadership, organizational culture, and how to influence change. *You want to explore wellness and self-discovery practices through an individual or team-building session. *You want to clarify your vision, purpose, values, theory of change and alignment to them. *You want to strengthen your organization‚Äôs learning culture and evaluative practices. *You want to develop an evaluation strategy that aligns with your values and principles. *You want to refine your advocacy strategies and policy agendas. *You want to convene systems leaders around a particular issue. We are your PROPONENT! Your learning and transformation partner that supports you in leading and influencing change.

education school linkedin description (1: Since 1885, we at Springfield College have had a singular focus on educating students‚Äîin spirit, mind, and body‚Äîfor leadership in service to others. We call it our Humanics philosophy. The world has changed since 1885, and we have, too. New academic programs, renovations, construction, and other major developments have ensured that we remain relevant to today‚Äôs students and society. One thing that hasn‚Äôt changed is our Humanics focus. That means that we place great emphasis on helping students grow their whole person, enter fields that help others, and serve as leaders in their communities, organizations, and companies, at home and around the world. Offering bachelor‚Äôs, master‚Äôs, and doctoral degrees, Springfield College is the best destination for those seeking a well-rounded education, strong academics, experiential learning opportunities, and active and fulfilling co-curricular and athletic involvement.
education school linkedin description (2: Mount Saint Mary College is a private, four-year liberal arts college in the Mid Hudson Valley region of New York State. Mission Mount Saint Mary College is an independent, coeducational institution committed to providing students with a liberal arts education to prepare them for lives of leadership and service. Through a variety of majors and professional programs, students are also prepared for career entry or graduate and professional studies. Consistent with Judeo-Christian values and the Dominican tradition of education that values the inherent worth of the individual, the mission of Mount Saint Mary College is to create an environment which fosters close student-faculty interaction that enables students to reach their full potential as lifelong learners. Description Mount Saint Mary College offers an affordable liberal arts education with strong academic undergraduate programs and three graduate programs. Our degree programs in business, education, the health professions, media arts and the social sciences are linked to high career growth fields. Mount students excel by completing internships and study abroad experiences that add dimension and value to their education. General Information The Mount accepts applications on a rolling admissions basis, which means you can apply all year round. Come visit our beautiful Hudson Valley campus; there's so much to see and to learn here. The Mount is growing and expanding every year. To reach the Mount's Office of Admissions, call 1-888-YES-MSMC or send an email to admissions@msmc.edu.
education school linkedin description (3: St. Thomas Aquinas College is an independent liberal arts college, which provides education at the undergraduate and graduate levels. The College requires each undergraduate to attain a broad foundation in the liberal arts and sciences. The College provides a range of undergraduate majors and graduate programs to assist students to prepare for careers and/or graduate studies through a deeper focus in a major field of study. St. Thomas Aquinas College creates a welcoming, caring and challenging environment for learning. Intensely student-centered academic activities and vigorous student-life programs are purposefully combined to enhance the educational process and to foster intellectual, moral, social and spiritual growth. The rolling admissions process allows students to apply during the year and receive an admission decision in a timely fashion. Our graduates have successful careers and excel in graduate studies. Come be a part of an exciting academic community!

summary: I‚Äôm Karl Allen-Muncey ‚Äî a creative strategist, storyteller, and innovation leader with over 20 years of experience building brands, technologies, and ideas that connect people. My career has taken me from founding a tech company at 19 to leading innovation labs, launching global brands, and creating content that inspires others to rediscover themselves through motorcycles, creativity, and community. Today, I split my time between business and storytelling ‚Äî as a marketing strategist, content creator, and mental health advocate. I‚Äôm the founder and face behind Zen Motorcycle Maintenance, a community of over 160,000 riders and a reach of more than 10 million monthly views, where I explore the intersection of motorcycles, philosophy, and mental health. I‚Äôm an official ambassador for Royal Enfield Motorcycles (and their Himalayan 450) and Cardo Systems, and I‚Äôve collaborated with industry leaders including Honda, QuadLock, Biltwell, and Hedon Helmets. My work extends beyond the screen ‚Äî leading rides, speaking at events, and creating experiences that remind riders to maintain their minds as well as their machines. As the author of The MotoJournal and creator of the Spark Unplugged personal growth program, I help people reconnect with their creativity, purpose, and balance in a hyper-connected world. Before this chapter, I served as Chief Marketing Officer at Auper Motorcycles, leading global strategy for an electric motorcycle startup, and as Head of Corporate Innovation at The Accelerator Centre, where I built programs connecting corporations with startups to pilot and commercialize new technologies. I‚Äôve also founded and led three major innovation labs ‚Äî in Kitchener, Halifax, and Toronto ‚Äî partnering with government, academia, and industry to push what‚Äôs possible. I‚Äôve spent my career proving that creativity, technology, and humanity belong together. Whether it‚Äôs developing new ventures, mentoring founders, or crafting stories that inspire, my goal is always the same ‚Äî to build things that make people think, feel, and grow. Let‚Äôs grab a coffee and talk about what‚Äôs next.
linkedin description: The MotoJournal is a unique, dual-purpose logbook designed for motorcyclists who want to care for both their bikes and their well-being. Part motorcycle maintenance journal, part personal growth tool, The MotoJournal invites riders to track the upkeep of their motorcycles while reflecting on their own mental health and personal journey. More than just a tool for documenting miles or repairs, The MotoJournal fosters mindfulness, encouraging motorcyclists to connect with the introspective side of riding. It‚Äôs a companion for both the open road and the inner journey, capturing not just the adventures of motorcycling but also the personal growth that comes with it. Built by the motorcycle community, for the motorcycle community, The MotoJournal has become a platform for connection, collaboration, and conversation. It‚Äôs designed for the discerning rider who values not only the care of their machine but also the care of their mind. Whether you‚Äôre looking to log your rides, set personal goals, or join a supportive community of like-minded individuals, The MotoJournal is your companion on the road to a more mindful and fulfilling riding experience.

summary: My executive leadership coaching practice focuses on scaling the impact of executives and teams by elevating emotional intelligence and learner resilience. job description: RARE Coaching & Consulting is comprised of over 30 certified coaches who support senior and emerging leaders to increase self-awareness, emotional intelligence, and overall impact and effectiveness. summary: As a business owner, you‚Äôre often pulled in too many directions, leaving crucial operational challenges on the back burner. That‚Äôs where I come in. As a Fractional COO, I step in to solve the pressing problems you don‚Äôt have the time to address‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs improving efficiency, reducing turnover, or preparing for major growth. My goal is to take the operational load off your shoulders so you can focus on what matters most: driving your business forward. WHAT IS A FRACTIONAL COO? A Fractional COO is an experienced Chief Operating Officer who works with your business on a part-time or project basis. You get the expertise of a full-time COO without the overhead costs. I step in to manage your operations, streamline your processes, and tackle the day-to-day challenges that you simply don‚Äôt have time for. From optimizing systems to improving profitability, I ensure your business runs smoothly so you can focus on growth. HOW I HELP YOU! Operational Problem-Solving: I specialize in taking care of the crucial issues that often get overlooked, from inefficiencies in your business to implementing systems that save time and money. Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A): If you're looking to grow through acquisitions or prepare your business for sale, I provide comprehensive guidance on sourcing deals, managing transactions, and integrating operations. Strategic Growth: Whether scaling a franchise from one to multiple locations or growing market share for real estate brokerages, I create tailored strategies to fuel sustainable growth. WHAT SETS ME APART: I understand that running a business is stressful, and I approach my clients with an empathetic, non-judgmental attitude. My role is not to point out what‚Äôs wrong but to work alongside you to find solutions and make your business stronger. I know the pressure you face, and I‚Äôm here to help. My background in real estate and franchising means I bring industry-specific expertise, but my unique, people-first approach ensures we build a relationship based on trust and understanding. LET'S CONNECT: If you‚Äôre ready to take your business to the next level or simply want to explore how I can help you grow, let‚Äôs chat. Feel free to message me here on LinkedIn or email me at guybarretta@thecooguy.com SPECIALTIES: Strategic Planning‚óò Project Execution ‚óò P&L Analysis ‚óò Mergers & Acquisitions ‚óò Business Development ‚óò Market Analysis ‚óò Sales Management ‚óò Business Consulting ‚óò Strategic Thinking ‚óò Team Leadership ‚óò Coaching & Mentoring ‚óò Process Optimization ‚óò Operational Strategy ‚óò Revenue Growth

Beyond the professional realm, my journey reflects a deep commitment to understanding the challenges entrepreneurs face daily. This commitment led me to found Barretta Consulting, driven by a mission to "guide your strategy one success at a time." As a Fractional COO, I specialize in helping business owners manage day-to-day operations effectively without breaking the bank, allowing them to concentrate on the core aspects of their business. * Fractional COO and Business Consultant to residential and commercial real estate brokerages as well as to small to medium size businesses throughout the United States. *Assist brokerages and companies with growth, strategy, operational efficiency and recruiting. * Work with companies and brokerages to help them with the operational decisions they cannot get to including new technologies to implement, streamlining of internal processes and putting together training and development programs for employees, agents and associates.

summary: I am a practical strategist, leadership coach, author, and professor working at the intersection of faith and real-world impact. Drawing from experience as a business executive, pastor, educator, and a leading voice in the U.S. faith and work movement, I am passionate to see people fully activated and engaged in their callings, to accelerate and facilitate transformation of leaders and organizations, and for the local church to be equipped to lead people into a biblical understanding of faith, work, and economic wisdom. I was an Area Vice-President with AT&T by age 30, then served as a pastor under Pastor Rick Warren at Saddleback Church where I was the architect and visionary of Saddleback@Work, the workplace ministry. Currently, I am an ICF certified leadership and strategy coach, a professor of ethics, leadership, and strategy at The Crowell School of Business at Biola University, and the Director of the Talbot Center for Faith, Work & Economics where I empower believers to work from biblical principles in all areas of their lives and work with pastors to build organizational competency in the local church to effectively disciple people in their work life. I hold master's degrees in both leadership and theology from Biola University and have studied in the Executive Program at Columbia University. Specialties include: ‚Ä¢ Executive coaching ‚Ä¢ Leadership development ‚Ä¢ Strategic and operational alignment ‚Ä¢ Ethics ‚Ä¢ Organizational change and cultural transformation ‚Ä¢ Employee engagement ‚Ä¢ Theology of work ‚Ä¢ Walking out the calling in the marketplace ‚Ä¢ Women‚Äôs leadership and influence ‚Ä¢ Faith-work integration in the local church ‚Ä¢ Research on sustainable worklife ministry models for impact ‚Ä¢ Developing and maintaining workplace small groups

linkedin description: Welcome to the Crowell School of Business where we provide a distinctive approach to business leadership. We call it Business as Ministry. Why is this important? Because business touches every area of contemporary life from the latest products to essential services, and we can‚Äôt live without the benefits today‚Äôs companies provide. But we regularly read about corporations or even whole industries that seem to stumble from one ethics-related crisis to another. We see failures of leadership at once-trusted brands that cast doubt on pursuing business as a career. Can business be conducted in a way that benefits society, builds profitable and sustainable companies, and is consistent with Christian faith? At the Crowell School of Business our faculty believes that business may be one of the most impactful career choices available for lives of service today. Whether in a public or private company, for profit or non-profit, known brand or entrepreneurial start up, the knowledge and skills you gain at the Crowell School will be valuable for a lifetime of impact. Why are we uniquely positioned to provide this distinctive approach to business leadership? Because the Crowell School faculty along with the other five schools at Biola University take the integration of faith and knowledge seriously as it applies to business, theology, the arts and sciences, humanities and more. Few business schools work so intentionally to pull from various academic and spiritual disciplines to equip students for lives of significance and impact. At Crowell, business education is designed so you learn and put into practice career-relevant business skills while engaging your faith and launching your career. We invite you to learn more about our School and programs by following us on LinkedIn and going to our web page. Or even better: come by and visit us some time!

summary: Anne Tammel, founder of OC CEO Collective and SoCal Women in Business, is a chief executive advisor and strategy consultant, guiding organizational leaders through cultural transformation, competitive positioning, and strategic growth. Redefining leadership, author of Poets and Dreamers: Thought Leaders and Visionaries and the forthcoming OC CEO Journal, Anne is a public speaker who leads transformative, high-engagement business experiences and CEO masterminds focused on leadership strategy, executive presence, and entrepreneurial mindset. Drawing on decades of experience across Silicon Valley, global corporations, and entrepreneurship, Anne brings clarity, structure, and human-centered strategy to organizations navigating growth and transition. Her advisory background includes executives from Google, YouTube, Microsoft, Citi, Bank of America, Merrill Lynch, EY, PwC, Deloitte, Neiman Marcus, Macy‚Äôs, IBM, Baxter, gold-medal Olympian athletes, global nonprofits, founders, and emerging ventures. Having begun her career at the Silicon Valley's leading PR firm, Cunningham Communication, architecting positioning strategy and brand communications frameworks for the most influential leaders in tech, Anne‚Äôs philosophy blends Silicon Valley strategy with the USC Marshall ethos of organizational excellence, emotional intelligence, and contemporary leadership design. Drawing from her work as founder of Poets and Dreamers LLC, where Anne developed a positive team culture model for high conflict organizations, Anne now curates and leads high-engagement executive leadership events, CEO roundtables, executive masterminds, leadership retreats, and programs that strengthen cultural identity, elevate executive presence, and unlock collaborative performance. With a Master of Executive Leadership from USC, an MFA in Creative Writing, and as an MBA candidate from USC Marshall, Anne is an ICF Professional Certified Coach (PCC), an ICF Advanced Certified Team Coach (ACTC), who integrates systems thinking, emotional intelligence, and neuroscience. Recognized by CBS Los Angeles for leading community transformation, Anne leads a regional movement focused on redefining leadership, uniting and elevating women in business, and shaping organizational identity. - Strategic Planning, Growth + CEO Advisory - Leadership Development Programs + Summits - Communications, Positioning + Thought Leadership - Culture Transformation + Organizational Identity - Executive Coaching + Leadership Strategy - Team Coaching; Collective Performance - Emotional Intelligence; Resilience Development

job description (2): Our Mission Engage all segments of our community to drive sustainable change in education, income, health and homelessness, while continuing to address urgent and basic human care. Our Vision Metro Atlanta is a place where all individuals and families thrive.
linkedin description (2): When children thrive, we all thrive. Kids are born with limitless potential. And every child ‚Äîfrom McDonough to Marietta, from College Park to Norcross, from Atlanta to Austell‚Äîdeserves the opportunity to thrive. But in Greater Atlanta, thousands of kids are faced with roadblocks where they should be met with possibilities. When we unite, we can unlock their potential, creating a brighter future, for every community. Our Child Well-Being Index shows that in 79 neighborhoods across our region, child well-being is declining. These neighborhoods are located in every one of Greater Atlanta's 13 counties, and often they're separated by just a few short blocks from the neighborhoods with the most access to opportunity. For the 77,000 youth who call these neighborhoods home, that means that they're facing inequitable barriers to success. They have big dreams‚Äîbut gaps in opportunities and resources stand in their way of achieving them. These aren‚Äôt just numbers. They‚Äôre our neighbors. When you join the movement to improve child well-being, you open pathways to opportunity, helping to: - Give more families access to quality early learning programs, so kids become strong learners. - Provide apprenticeship opportunities for youth, equipping them for high-growth careers. - Put college within reach for more families, through academic supports and financial aid access. - Set individuals up for financial stability, through stable housing, access to healthcare and employment opportunities. - Support community-led solutions, so that everyone‚Äîregardless of race or zip code‚Äîcan thrive. Our guiding question is ‚Äúhow are the children?‚Äù United, we‚Äôre working toward a future where we can respond with ‚Äúall the children are well.‚Äù Join the movement at unitedwayatlanta.org

summary: You know how hard it is to buy fresh food at reasonable prices year-round that hasn‚Äôt travelled thousands of miles and arrived at the grocery store still ‚Äúgreen‚Äù? Nearly 19 million people in the US live in ‚Äúfood deserts‚Äù, meaning they don‚Äôt live near a grocery store. It‚Äôs not just lower-income folks that struggle. Big cities like LA and NY and Chicago have trouble providing fresh food to its citizens. I work with architects, engineers, farmers, and city planners to create buildings that come alive and are a source of food for the people that live there. There tends to be a struggle between architects, engineers, and city planners to develop indoor farms that meet strict building codes, are architecturally attractive, and can grow the foods that people want to eat. Growing thousands of plants indoors with these building restrictions quickly complicate the project. The people that are involved in these projects have specialized knowledge, like a musician in a symphony. They are experts at their instrument and look to the Conductor to provide guidance on when and how to play so that the music is played beautifully for the audience. I‚Äôm like the conductor when it comes to these big projects. I can ‚Äúsee‚Äù how, when, and where, the players need to bring their specialized knowledge to create the building that grows the food desired by the audience (in this case, the people that live in the city). Conductors know when certain instrument need to play louder, softer, and not at all. As the conductor, I know when to engage the engineers, architects, farmers, city planners and funders. When people work with me, they know they are an integral part of the team and how their role fits into production. More important, they can focus on bringing their specialized skills and talents to the project, free from the stresses of micromanaging components that don‚Äôt excite them or detract from what they love working on. What kind of food sustainability projects are you trying to build? I'd love to listen and see how I can support your efforts.

Approach: I believe in a participatory approach that involves you in the process, ensuring solutions are grounded in your experiences and insights. Our work is rooted in authenticity, inclusivity, and a commitment to challenging the status quo. I pride myself on being a professional troublemaker and positive disruptor, dedicated to making a meaningful impact. Join me on a journey of transformation where your success and well-being are our top priorities. Let‚Äôs redefine professionalism together and build a culture that values diversity, equity, and inclusion.

education school linkedin description (1: The University of Cincinnati, top 5 university for co-op and internships, offers students a balance of academic excellence and real-world experience. Since its founding in 1819, UC has been the source of many discoveries creating positive change for society, including the first antihistamine, the first cooperative education program, the first electronic organ, and the oral polio vaccine. Each year, this urban, public, research university graduates nearly 10,000 students, adding to more than 300,000 living alumni around the world. UC is the largest employer in the Cincinnati region, with an economic impact of more than $4.2 billion.

linkedin description: When a community's businesses are successful, the families connected to those businesses and the community itself are stronger. summary: Most business owners work hard ‚Äî but few see that effort turn into consistent profit. That‚Äôs where I come in.
