job description: Using ScaleSure‚Ñ¢ Path, I help owner-led businesses ($500K‚Äì$20M) stop guessing and start winning by applying a proven order of operations: cash flow first, profits next, and then revenue growth. Through the Jumpstart 12 roadmap, business owners get clear, actionable steps across 12 revenue and profit levers ‚Äî starting with cost control, pricing power, and cash acceleration before moving to top-line expansion. Key Deliverables & Results: Cash Flow: Unlock cash trapped in AR, inventory, and supplier terms ‚Äî typically reducing Days Sales Outstanding by 7‚Äì10 days and freeing working capital within weeks. Profitability: Apply disciplined pricing, cost-cutting, bundling, and upsell strategies to expand margins by 2‚Äì4% without sacrificing volume. Revenue Growth: Build durable lead generation, joint ventures, drip campaigns, and digital marketing funnels that drive qualified demand once the financial foundation is strong. Jumpstart 12 Modules include: Cash Flow Levers: Cost Cutting, Pricing, AR/AP/Inventory discipline Profit Expansion: Upsells, Cross-Sells, Bundling, Downsell strategies Revenue Growth: Market-Dominating Position, Joint Ventures, Drip Campaigns, Digital Marketing The result: a business that generates cash today, profits tomorrow, and scalable growth for the long term. summary: ‚Ä¢ What is the meaning of life? ‚Ä¢ You are living life as if what is its meaning? ‚Ä¢ Do you know why you are here and for what purpose? ‚Ä¢ How do you measure your life? ‚Ä¢ Are you satisfied with the quality of your life? It all started with a paradox. Years ago, I went through a difficult period asking myself precisely the questions above. Searching for answers, I discovered that others shared my concerns. As I described it in my first book, I faced a paradox: "Humanity does not suffer from a lack of answers; rather, it suffers despite the answers being available." This paradox became the central quest that led to the start of a new school of psychology: meaningful purpose. Fortunately, I discovered the answers to these existential questions, solved the paradox, and built a practice to help people get the necessary remedies. The point? You, too, can deal with your own paradoxes and benefit by finding the answers to these existential questions. So, if you have big plans and have been giving your all ‚Ä¶ YET you are struggling with any of the following ‚Ä¶ ‚Ä¢ Resistance to your efforts to make a positive difference at work and in social settings. ‚Ä¢ Lack of Support preventing you from achieving your professional goals and life dreams. ‚Ä¢ Discouragement from trying to bring to life relationships that should thrive but don't. ‚Ä¢ Frustration that your contributions are not being acknowledged and appreciated. ‚Ä¢ Disappointment with people who are indifferent and unresponsive to your contributions, aspirations, and talent. ‚Ä¢ Exhaustion from investing in long hours at work for little to no appreciation. ‚Ä¢ Disappointed that your life lacks meaning and direction. But there is hope! The Boston Institute for Meaningful Purpose has something to end the pain. It is called "Meaning Analysis and Improvement." When you harness the "Meaning Analysis and Improvement" method, you will ‚Ä¶ ‚Ä¢ Deepen your self-understanding and of your surroundings. ‚Ä¢ Build your self-confidence. ‚Ä¢ Discover your strengths and confront your weaknesses courageously for self-improvement. ‚Ä¢ Discern what other's agendas and their motives are. ‚Ä¢ Know the "real" root cause of a problem or situation. ‚Ä¢ Understand what your options are and how to select the most promising one. Check my LinkedIn references to read what some of our happy clients say. I will be happy to meet you through Luis@bostonimp.com and www.bostonimp.com. Boston Institute for Meaningful Purpose. Discovering Life‚Äôs Answers.

linkedin description: The International Positive Psychology Association (IPPA) is a global membership organization of thousands of academics and educators, practitioners and clinicians, students, and others ‚Äì from over 70 countries worldwide. The field of positive psychology focuses on the study and practice of positive emotions and the strengths and virtues that make all individuals, institutions, and communities thrive. The field has seen hundreds of millions of dollars invested into research, the founding of scientific journals, creation of baccalaureate degrees and masters and Ph.D. programs at universities, TEDx Talks, and reports and cover stories in major news and media outlets worldwide (including Forbes, The Atlantic, The Washington Post, The Guardian, Time Magazine, Parents Magazine, Wall Street Journal, Newsweek, U.S. News & World Report, and more). In addition, award-winning books and publications on both the science and practice of positive psychology have been released through publishing houses including McGraw-Hill, Wiley, Simon & Schuster, Penguin, and others ‚Äì increasing global exposure and prominence. IPPA's three-part mission is: - To promote the science of positive psychology and its research-based applications. - To facilitate collaboration among researchers, teachers, students, and practitioners of positive psychology around the world and across academic disciplines. - To share the findings of positive psychology with the broadest possible audience. In all of these endeavors, IPPA works to create rigorous standards for positive psychology, so that the field always represents the very best levels of current knowledge. If you share in this mission and vision, we hope you will consider joining us.

linkedin description (3): The U.S. National Science Foundation (NSF) is an independent federal agency created by Congress in 1950 "to promote the progress of science; to advance the national health, prosperity, and welfare; to secure the national defense‚Ä¶"‚Äã With an annual budget of more than $8 billion, NSF is the funding source for approximately 20 percent of all federally supported basic research conducted by America‚Äôs colleges and universities. In many fields, such as mathematics, computer science, and the social sciences, NSF is the major source of federal backing. NSF awards about 11,000 new awards per year, with an average duration of three years -- to fund specific research proposals that have been judged the most promising by a rigorous and objective merit-review system. In the past few decades, NSF-funded researchers have won more than 200 Nobel Prizes as well as other honors too numerous to list. NSF funds equipment that is needed by scientists and engineers but is often too expensive for any one group or researcher to afford. Another essential element in NSF's mission is support for science and engineering education, from pre-K through graduate school and beyond. There are many exciting careers at NSF, not only in science, technology, education and mathematics (STEM), but also in business and operations. For more information, please visit us at http://nsf.gov/careers/. NSF welcomes opportunities to engage with you on our LinkedIn page. Please see our Comment Policy [http://www.nsf.gov/social/policies.jsp ] for more information.

summary: For over 40 years, entrepreneur, best-selling author, business coach and organizational consultant, Monika K. Moss-Gransberry (www.monikakmoss.com) has dedicated her talents to transforming organizations and building the capacity of individuals in them. Founder of MKM Management Consulting LLC, Monika is a trusted thinking partner, master facilitator and executive coach, whose systems approach, expands her clients‚Äô capacity to accomplish their vision in a constantly changing environment, where complex factors dictate an integrated strategic solution. A certified Gestalt Organizational Systems Development Practitioner, Monika currently serves on the faculty of the Gestalt Organizational Systems Development Center which trains leaders around the world in organizational effectiveness and self-mastery. She is a senior coach and trainer for Move the Crowd, training the next generation of conscious entrepreneurs and visionary leaders and serves on the faculty of the Goldman Sachs 10,000 Small Business Initiative both the Cleveland and National Programs. She has taught at several universities and is a regular presenter and trainer at regional and national conferences. Monika holds Bachelors and Masters Degrees from Howard University and Columbia University, respectively, is a 2007 graduate of Leadership Cleveland, and involved with numerous community organizations. summary: James A. Cooper Jr., MA (He/Him/His) is a visionary leader, impact strategist, and tireless advocate for equity in education and workforce development. He is the Founder & CEO of James Cooper Consulting LLC, a career and workforce development firm, and Black, Educated, Successful, Thriving (B.E.S.T.) Young Male Enrichment Program, a Minnesota-based nonprofit he launched in 2024 to empower young Black men to thrive in school, career, and life. A proud Liberian immigrant, first-generation college graduate, and lifelong community builder, James draws on both lived experience and professional expertise to create transformative opportunities for historically marginalized communities. His work focuses on college and career access, workforce development, culturally responsive youth development, and systems-level change. James holds a Master‚Äôs degree in Organizational Leadership, Policy, and Development and is a proud member of Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity, Inc. He also serves on the Board of Directors for the Wilson‚Äôs Image College Scholarship. Whether he‚Äôs coaching dynamic leaders or shaping policy conversations, James remains rooted in his purpose: as we rise, we must bring others with us.

summary: Strategic thinker and relationship manager. Business developer. Innovator. Certified in Corporate Social Responsibility. Mentor. Author. Applying more than 25 years of consulting and client management experience, Lori's most recent role was as the Client Experience Leader for Buck, a global HR and benefits consulting, technology, and administration firm. In this role, Lori works with the firm's most strategic clients, and her colleagues who serve those clients, to strengthen those relationships. Over the course of her career, Lori has overseen the successful implementation of numerous, often award-winning, multifaceted communication engagements and technology-based solutions, collaborated with clients to develop executable strategic roadmaps that address a wide range of organization issues, all while serving as a senior-level client executive. She has cultivated relationships at all levels within client organizations and internally, authored numerous thought-provoking pieces, spoken frequently at industry conferences, mentored numerous individuals, and is known for challenging the status quo. Most recently, Lori has completed the intensive, 14-week Corporate Social Responsibility certification program, offered through the University of Colorado-Boulder Leeds' Business School's Center for Ethics and Social Responsibility. An avid swimmer, Lori's passion for and tenacity in the water - she completed a 10K open water swim just a few years ago - carries over to her work in the form of commitment, energy, and passion.
job description: The changes resulting from the events of the last few years ‚Äî and those still unfolding ‚Äî mark a turning point in the history of humanity and the world of work. At emHrge‚Ñ¢ our purpose is to go beyond addressing those changes to embrace them. emHrge‚Ñ¢ consulting aspires to advance individual and community wellbeing and to improve the world of work, while helping organizations deliver meaningful value to all stakeholders.
linkedin description: We're at a turning point in the history of Humanity and the world of work. We're emerging into something new. We‚Äôre moving out of the worst of the pandemic and away from the longstanding 9-to-5, office-bound way of working. It‚Äôs apparent we‚Äôre at critical juncture when it comes to sustaining our way of life ‚Äî we must embrace new ways of doing things if we‚Äôre to protect the planet, people, and, of course, profits. And it‚Äôs well known many HR programs are no longer fit for purpose in this emerging world. Against this backdrop emHrge‚Ñ¢ was born. Not because we think the world needs another HR consulting firm, but because we believe the world does need a Humanity-at-the-center consulting firm. When you choose emHrge, you gain access to high-caliber strategic advice and technical know-how under one umbrella. With corporate social responsibility as our guiding light, and the UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) as critical benchmarks, we‚Äôll help you boost your organization‚Äôs results while advancing human wellbeing both within and beyond your workplaces. Visit us at www.emhrge.com or drop us a note at contactus@emhrge.com.
job description (2): Braven‚Äôs mission is to empower promising, underrepresented young people‚Äîfirst-generation college students, students from low-income backgrounds, and/or students of color‚Äîwith the skills, confidence, experiences, and networks necessary to transition from college to strong first jobs, which lead to meaningful careers and lives of impact. In my volunteer leadership coaching role, I facilitate weekly sessions with a cohort of college students (5-8) helping them take their first steps into the professional world while still attending school.
linkedin description (2): Braven empowers promising young people on their path to college graduation and strong first jobs. We believe that our next generation of leaders will emerge from everywhere, so we take a particular interest in ensuring our talent network is filled with people from underrepresented backgrounds. To do so, Braven partners with educational institutions, volunteer professionals, and employers to offer a rigorous and relevant career readiness course, that is followed by robust campus-based alumni programming. The course is targeted as a part of the sophomore or transfer junior experience. Through The Braven Accelerator, a hybrid online and in-person course, Braven Fellows will get: --Skills: learn the hard and soft skills companies and organizations want and practice them in mock professional settings. --Experience: apply skills to solve real-world challenges with a cohort of peers. --Coaching: receive small group and one-on-one coaching from a local young professional to achieve personal and professional goals. --Networking: expand one‚Äôs circle of champions to include motivated peers, supportive adults, and respected thought-leaders. The Braven Accelerator is principally facilitated by volunteer Leadership Coaches who come from all walks of life and all believe that our nation is better off when a person‚Äôs starting point does not limit their opportunities. Leadership Coaches guide our nation‚Äôs future leaders through this meaningful experience. At the same time, they develop and practice leadership and management skills that accelerate their own careers. They also develop their own network and deepen their connection to the community in which they live and/or work. This unique, high-impact volunteer opportunity employs a primarily virtual coaching model. From The Braven Accelerator will come a generation of leaders as diverse as our future demands.

summary: Shannon Parris is an innovative management consultant who equips nonprofit leaders and entrepreneurs to realize their visions and achieve their goals. With a decade of experience, she is a pragmatic accountability partner and empathetic coach, helping clients protect their time. Whether they need to launch a new project or program, operationalize a strategy, or simplify a process, Shannon enables clients to boost their capacity and reach ambitious goals. Shannon is passionate about developing the next generation of nonprofit leaders and entrepreneurs. A former nonprofit program director and serial entrepreneur, she knows that the people who are closest to the work often understand it best. Her approach blends strategic insight with practical guidance to support underrepresented leaders transitioning into new roles. Shannon built her operations and strategy expertise through versatile professional experiences. At Omicelo Cares, she launched a business accelerator that helped over one hundred small business owners increase their revenue, make strategic decisions, and embrace their leadership roles. She previously worked at ACLU of Pennsylvania, indie craft fair I Made It! Market, and nonprofit resale boutique WearWoof. Shannon also serves on the Equal Opportunity Board in Ross Township, a neighborhood in North Pittsburgh, and she completed a term on the board of Handmade Arcade, a nonprofit that supports makers and creative entrepreneurs. As a Korean adoptee raised in a predominantly white community, Shannon has a unique perspective on privilege and equity. She is most passionate about working to dismantle systems of oppression and to advocate for and galvanize nonprofit leaders and entrepreneurs with marginalized identities.
job description: I am an equity-first management consultant, or as my clients think of me, a trusted, outsourced business partner. I help under-resourced entrepreneurs and nonprofit professionals activate their strategies, optimize their operations, measure and maximize their impact, and foster equitable environments so they can boost their capacity, resolve complex issues, and do the hard work of changing the world.
linkedin description: I propel nonprofits and small businesses to reach ambitious goals while protecting and uplifting the people who power them. I create equity-driven strategies for your specific needs by analyzing all aspects of your work, from the processes to the people. Whether navigating tough relationships or wading through convoluted systems, my people-centered approach creates practical solutions that last. I am not afraid of complexity‚Äîin fact, it‚Äôs where I do my best work. I support entrepreneurs at every stage, from startup to sale, and help nonprofit leaders plan, manage, and evaluate their programs, strategies, and culture. Every engagement includes empathetic coaching that empowers you to realize your vision.
job description (2): Real Kids International designs and manufactures products for caregivers of neurodivergent and highly sensitive kids, like Picky Eaters, food picks that make eating fun, and Implement, an innovative 3D printed water play platform. Our goal is to create unique physical and digital products that help grownups connect with their kids. In 2023, we developed Implement and installed an institution-scale prototype at a childcare facility in McKeesport, PA. We utilized plastic 3D printing manufacturing for low-cost, rapid, on-demand production of parts that can be made anywhere in the world. In 2021, we learned about Picky Eaters, a line of BPA-free, dishwasher safe, and CPSC-certified food picks for children. We fell in love with the characters and the idea of providing a tool for making part of parenting a little bit easier. In May 2024, when we began developing a business plan for Implement, Real Kids International acquired Picky Eaters to expand our product line. The Picky Eaters characters are now being developed into cartoons, affectionately called ‚ÄúReal Kids,‚Äù which will live in a digital universe and help spread our message of connection and acceptance. The Real Kids characters will also be developed into physical and digital products, forming a bridge between our two major product lines, Picky Eaters and Implement. At the heart of Real Kids International is a deep commitment to inclusion and empowerment. Through our products, community initiatives, and advocacy efforts, we are working toward a world where neurodivergent children are celebrated for who they are, where they feel valued and included, and where every caregiver feels supported on their journey.

summary: I'm Sam Goodman, speaker, advisor, consultant, HOP practitioner, and proudly "The HOP Nerd." But perhaps most importantly, I'm the Creator of "Starting Points: Operationally Curious Questions." I developed this framework because I saw a need for simple, powerful tools to ignite genuine operational curiosity and learning - focusing on learning within daily operations and anticipating challenges, rather than solely reacting after events. For nearly two decades, Safety, Leadership, and Human and Organizational Performance (HOP) hasn't just been my job; it's been my passion. My path includes significant leadership roles in demanding environments like commercial nuclear generation and deep experience across power generation, maintenance, construction, and other high-risk industries. Through The HOP Nerd LLC, I bring this experience directly to organizations globally. I partner across sectors - from healthcare and biomedical to oil & gas, utilities, power generation, chemicals, mining, and diverse manufacturing ‚Äì helping them: Truly operationalize HOP principles. Build high-impact Learning Teams. Foster work environments of curiosity, improvement, and innovation. I thrive on helping organizations learn from their own operations. It's a message I also share as a keynote speaker, an author of multiple best-selling books, and through The HOP Nerd Podcast. If you're looking to embed HOP, grow operational curiosity and learning, and achieve lasting performance improvements, let's connect. I'm always up for a conversation about making work better.
job description: Founder, Human and Organizational Performance practitioner, and safety consultant at The HOP Nerd LLC. summary: https://www.frequencymatters.org Founder/Creator of the registered Trademarked Brand: Frequency Matters¬Æ - the energy advantage. Manage Your Particles‚Ñ¢ Frequency Matters¬Æ My Story I have had a passion for the energetics and quantum physics since birth. My first book is underpined by quantum particles, quantum entanglement and cartoons to help these complicated ideas flourish. After working with thousands of people in every industry you can imagine, I identified parallels and insights then crystalized these ideas into the work I do today. I love making complicated concepts enjoyable and relatable so that growth is more fluid and behaviors collaborative. We pioneered this work decades ago tossing quantum particles (golf balls) at The Musicians Hall of Fame in Nashville, TN with Frequency Matters¬Æ in a playful song, keynote address followed by warm and collaborative conversations in the breakout sessions. It was such an inspiring event with leaders, professionals and C-Suite innovators, we decided to create Frequency Matters¬Æ for leaders, teams and cultures. When a Nobel Prize was given in the science world in 2022 proving quantum entanglement, and again in 2023 (Anne L‚ÄôHuillier) folks stopped being so afraid of it. It‚Äôs physics. It‚Äôs energy. It‚Äôs sound. It‚Äôs humans. It's wellbeing. Qualitative and quantitative research along with direct case studies serve as the backbone of our work. summary: Driven by purpose and resilience, I‚Äôve transformed my lived experience with incarceration and growing up in an underserved Salt Lake City neighborhood into a mission: driving change across communities, organizations, and the justice system. Having faced poverty, incarceration, and reentry firsthand, I work to dismantle barriers and empower others to reclaim their stories while showing systems the power of lived experience. I design and deliver culturally responsive, community-rooted programs that disrupt incarceration cycles and create pathways to leadership, entrepreneurship, and opportunity. I don‚Äôt just study these systems‚ÄîI‚Äôve lived them. That perspective, combined with years of consulting with youth systems, nonprofits, and community groups, allows me to bridge the gap between community and institutions. I am a product of community. From early years shaped by gangs and incarceration to becoming a leader in justice reform and entrepreneurship, I know the power of mentorship and second chances. My leadership is supported by training through Goldman Sachs 10,000 Small Businesses, NeighborWorks West Side Leadership Institute, NeighborWorks America Community Leadership Institute, and the National Partners Juvenile Services Leadership Academy. With more than a decade of community building experience, I have: ‚Ä¢ Served as a Board Member for NeighborWorks Salt Lake ‚Ä¢ Advised youth inside facilities and developed mentorship for formerly incarcerated men ‚Ä¢ Founded Access to Excellence, disrupting the school-to-prison pipeline through peer-led, culturally grounded programs ‚Ä¢ Founded Purpose Driven Partners, supporting capacity building, leadership development, and strategic partnerships I also serve on the Small Business Advisory Committee for the Utah Black Chamber and as a Board Member and Business Coach for Defy Ventures Utah, a national nonprofit equipping incarcerated and formerly incarcerated individuals with entrepreneurship, employment, and personal development training. I‚Äôm open to consulting, partnerships, and collaborations with organizations ready to center community voices and build programs that last.
linkedin description: Defy Ventures' mission is to shift mindsets to give people with criminal histories their best shot at a second chance through career readiness, personal development, and entrepreneurship training programs offered in prisons and in the community. With a vision to cut recidivism rates in half by leveraging entrepreneurship to increase economic opportunity and transform lives, Defy currently works in seven states and sixteen prisons nationwide.

summary: I help mission-driven organizations and visionary leaders get out of the clouds and land the plane. Whether it's clarifying strategy, selecting the right software, or structuring teams for scale, I bring order to the messy middle ‚Äî turning good ideas into clear plans with aligned action. Through Strategic Matter, I work with churches, nonprofits, and founder-led businesses to: Align vision, mission, values, and operations Facilitate major decisions with buy-in and clarity Guide technology strategy, including software package selection and implementation Coach leadership teams to get aligned using the System & Soul framework I‚Äôm at my best pairing with visionary CEOs and mission-focused teams who know where they want to go ‚Äî but need help building the runway to get there. Let‚Äôs connect if you're in a season of transition, growth, or strategic decision-making and need a calm, structured guide to help you land the next move.
job description: The Firehouse Collective is a group of Franklin Business men, forming a COMMUNITY to build a NETWORK of VOLUNTEERS that serve Franklin SENIORS and their non-professional CAREGIVERS. As we launch the Firehouse Collective, I serve as the Secretary and "Operator." I'm building our launch plan and forming a new 501c3 with a talented group of business leaders and technical strategists to serve our Seniors. We believe that there's a loneliness epidemic affecting men and leaders in particular - and the loneliness is best resolved by serving together. We meet on the first and third Wednesdays of the month - and welcome new friends to the collective.
linkedin description: At The Firehouse Collective, we‚Äôre a group of friends, neighbors, and big-hearted doers who gather regularly in an old firehouse in Franklin, TN‚Äîsharing stories, ideas, and exploring how to better support our aging population. Born out of personal experiences with aging parents and a desire to bless our community, we‚Äôre building a nonprofit that connects people with resources to help seniors live independently and with dignity. There‚Äôs no agenda‚Äîjust genuine connection, real conversations, and a growing passion to make a difference for older adults and their families. Whether it‚Äôs pointing folks toward trusted services, sharing what we‚Äôve learned, or simply showing up with a willing heart, we believe in caring for those who once cared for us.

linkedin description (4): Businesses often struggle to get to the next level. Staff do their best to execute on the organizational mission and vision, but do so in silos, with their processes disconnected from one another, stuck in one person's head. As a result, customer experience can be hit-or-miss, balls get dropped between departmental handoffs, spreadsheets shuffle, and companies stall in growth. As organizations grow, the processes and practices that served them until now won't serve them in the future. Adding new layers of leadership and management requires upgrades to the way companies communicate and collaborate. With over 20 years experience helping organizations rapidly grow from 50 to 500+ employees, implement digital transformation initiatives, and build and document repeatable processes, Strategic Matter can help you identify the most important next steps in your strategy. Our process begins with a comprehensive assessment of your organization, incorporating your leadership team's perspectives on the current identity of the organization, deep analysis of the entire company's capacity for change, and a collaborative inventory of your operational maturity in over 47 facets of your business operations. From there, we customize an action plan prioritized to match your objectives and move your company forward with accountability and clarity. To gain momentum, we'll walk with you through implementation and ongoing management and improvement, revising the roadmap for your business as the horizon changes. Our extensive network of specialists can help fill any gaps - from HR, to marketing, to accounting and finance, to technology, we can help you build your team and go to your next level.

summary: You‚Äôre carrying a lot. Your decisions have impact. I help executive leaders and teams build responsive, reliable rhythms for energy, clarity and execution so you lead with capacity, not depletion. You hire me to deliver performance coaching and/or keynotes to build your culture, leadership capacity and organizational effectiveness. With over 20 years of experience as the Founder and Principal Executive Business Coach at Built for Hard, I support Fortune 500 leaders, small business owners, and executives in navigating leadership challenges, strategic decision-making, team restructuring, and legacy building. My work is grounded in fostering personal relationships and delivering strategic insights to empower leaders and organizations. As a Leadership and Change Speaker for over 17 years, I have collaborated with globally recognized organizations such as Microsoft, Amazon, Pfizer, and Mercedes-Benz to enable teams to thrive in competitive and evolving environments. My expertise in keynote speaking, profit and loss, and people management is complemented by a history of Olympic achievement and a commitment to resilience-driven leadership.
job description: When you are a Fortune 500 business unit leader, small business owner, or senior leader of a mid-sized organization, you deal with your share of leadership challenges. How do I manage the politics of my business and organization? What is the best strategic decision to make? How should I restructure the leadership team to put the right people in the right seats? Finally, when I retire, how do I maximize the organizational legacy (not the pompous titles and accolades, but the real change that makes a difference)? My clients know how much I care about building personal relationships and delivering the proper strategic insight at the right time. Caring deeply for my clients and providing a significant impact is the essence of my work. My experience comes from what I‚Äôve learned by overcoming my challenges and building an incredibly successful business, along with working with some of the most successful business leaders in America, Canada and Europe. This history has given me the knowledge and platform needed to inspire my clients to live their values and achieve their destinies. And that‚Äôs why I‚Äôm so passionate now about using my platform to give others confidence and peace of mind at different stages in their career, working alongside my clients to: ‚Ä¢ set more explicit goals that are in alignment with their values ‚Ä¢ refine their understanding of strategy and leadership ‚Ä¢ leave a functional legacy that is both humble and powerful ‚Ä¢ achieve a level of success that allows them to give back My work focuses on: Leadership ‚Äì How are you at influencing others and yourself? Have you clarified your vision and convinced others to help you achieve it? Change Management ‚Äì New position? Merger? Disruption? Policy change? Do you and your team have to tools to weather change? Teamwork ‚Äì Do you have the right people in the right place for the job? Strategy ‚Äì How clear are your personal goals? Team goals? Organizational goals? Are they in alignment?

summary: I‚Äôm on a mission to help an additional 100,000 women reset their mindset, rewrite their story, and rise into their power as leaders, innovators, and changemakers in every sphere of influence. Jeannetta guides women to dismantle fear-based beliefs, rebuild confidence, and reprogram their thinking for success. Focus: Mindset mastery, resilience, self-worth. 2. REWRITE: Own your story and design your future. Through guided strategies, women learn to rewrite their narratives with intention and purpose, aligning their identity with their desired impact. Focus: Personal leadership, identity alignment, clarity of purpose. 3. RISE: Step boldly into influence and impact. This is where vision meets execution ‚Äî empowering women to lead authentically, innovate boldly, and create ripple effects in business, leadership, and life. Focus: Leadership presence, execution, legacy. How We Measure Progress Transformation is measurable ‚Äî both personally and professionally. Jeannetta‚Äôs Empowerment Framework tracks growth through key dimensions: Dimension: Indicators of Progress Mindset: Confidence growth, resilience under pressure, decision-making clarity Leadership: Increased influence, strategic thinking, and leadership opportunities Business: Impact, Revenue Growth, Team Engagement, Goal Execution Legacy: Community & Global Impact Mentorship: Social Impact Initiatives, Sustainable Leadership Practices Progress is measured not just in success, but in sustainability ‚Äî how women continue to lead, build, and inspire long after the media is gone. Jeannetta Collier doesn‚Äôt just speak ‚Äî she ignites movement. Her Empowerment Framework has helped thousands of women transform their thinking, elevate their leadership, and redefine success on their own terms. summary: Rekha Gurnani Chowdhury is a Compensation, Rewards, and People Analytics expert with over two decades of experience spanning consulting, corporate leadership, and advisory roles across startups, scale-ups, and enterprise public companies. She specializes in compensation strategy, program design, execution, and communication, always guided by principles of equitability, scalability, and simplicity. With a background in Industrial/Organizational Psychology and an MBA from The Wharton School, Rekha offers a unique perspective to address challenges and opportunities to the Rewards function, transforming it into a strategic, data-driven source of competitive talent advantage directly impacting organizational and financial outcomes. An outspoken advocate for pay equity and pay transparency, Rekha serves as a coach, speaker, author, instructor, and thought leader in this domain. summary: I‚Äôm Keith Liscio, the Founder and President of Excelsior Franchise Center. My background and experience have uniquely prepared me to serve as a consultant and coach to prospective business owners considering an investment in a franchise system. My mission is to work with clients to winnow thousands of franchises down to a handful of good options, and ultimately the perfect business for them. I grew up in a series of small, family-run businesses ‚Äì everything from a dry-cleaning shop to a liquor store to a meat market/deli/bakery. After getting a degree in marketing from Villanova University (and later an MBA from the Wharton School) I turned my attention to the corporate world working at Fortune 500 Companies like Procter & Gamble, Nabisco, and Kraft. Eventually, I became an entrepreneur importing ceramics from Italy and then spending almost 20 years running my own Executive Recruiting firm. I was even employed by a couple of franchisees along the way, flipping burgers at McDonald‚Äôs in college and working at one of the Midwest‚Äôs leading offices for Management Recruiters International. If I‚Äôve learned anything along this journey it‚Äôs that running a business is NOT for everybody. Entrepreneurship is even tougher, taking long hours, expertise, commitment, and a high tolerance for risk. That said, business ownership can be incredibly fulfilling and offers many benefits in terms of work/life balance, financial rewards, and tax advantages. Best of all, being your own boss can be great. Really great. For many people, buying a franchise business can be the best way to become a business owner. You‚Äôre investing in an established system that‚Äôs already successful. You‚Äôre in business for yourself, but not by yourself. There are hundreds of options available allowing buyers to choose a business that capitalizes on their strengths and interests while accommodating their preferred working styles. Best of all, I know the GOOD franchises, can save you time and money, and there is no charge for my service. All my fees are paid from the marketing budgets of my franchise partners. If you‚Äôre serious about being in business, I can find one that will fit your needs. If you‚Äôd like to learn more, schedule some time on my calendar and I‚Äôd be happy to answer any questions you might have. Just click here: https://meetings.hubspot.com/keith-liscio
job description: My company, Excelsior Franchise Center, has teamed with the Franchise Brokers Association to partner with over 800 of America's best franchise systems. I help aspiring business owners to assess their goals, analyze their options, and realize their dreams of financial independence and work/life balance through franchise ownership. Have you ever thought of owning your own business? Does your RTO strategy include not returning to the office at all? Is your 401(k) taking a beating? Maybe it's time to invest in yourself. Reach out and I'd be happy to discuss your options. You can check out my calendar and find the time that works best for you here: https://meetings.hubspot.com/keith-liscio

job description: The Forum is an association of local Business Architecture professionals dedicated to understanding, documenting and implementing improvements for Business Architecture. The Twin Cities Business Architecture Forum (TCBAF) is a Minnesota-based organization dedicated to the understanding and advancement of the role and professional practice of business architecture. It exists to promote common definitions and standards, share ideas, and connect like-minded professionals with networking through meetings, activities, presentations, and educational development opportunities at the local level. Founding sponsors of the TCBAF include Express Scripts, Metropolitan State University, Target Corporation, Thrivent Financial, Trissential and other prominent Minneapolis organizations. Bi-monthly two hour meetings are held at a sponsor‚Äôs location. Meetings feature a brief presentation followed by a facilitated roundtable discussion ‚Äì a free flow of ideas is encouraged! There are no dues or membership fees associated with TCBAF at this time.

summary: A while back, I found myself at a crossroads.I wanted my next role to check three key boxes:‚úî Work with a leader I respected (or better yet, was inspired by)‚úî Be part of a company whose mission excited me‚úî Fit into a culture where people actually thrive. Then I realized ‚Äì finding all three was like looking for a needle in a wheat field.So, I stopped looking and started reflecting. What I really love‚Äîthe work that fires me up‚Äîis helping leaders and teams find their power and perform at their potential. Across my career, whether I was turning around a struggling nonprofit, helping to scale a cybersecurity firm, working on the Olympics, or running my own business, I kept seeing the same issue:‚û°Ô∏è Companies often put good people in leadership roles without the right training or support.‚û°Ô∏è Those leaders struggle, which leads to frustration, turnover, and wasted potential.‚û°Ô∏è The business suffers, and no one wins. summary: Mike is an expert in helping leaders be more inclusive and fully embrace their role in ongoing diversity, equity, inclusion, accessibility, and belonging conversations. The U.S. Freediving Federation is the youngest member of the CMAS family and happy to help continue the legacy started by Mr. Cousteau. The mission of the U.S. Freediving Federation is to bring awareness to freediving across the United States and support the efforts of all those that engage in the sport, whether it be for self-exploration and adventure, therapeutic benefits, or purely competition ‚Äì in the safest manner possible.

job description: Founded and lead a national organization that creates and maintains an ecosystem that helps schools and districts recruit, retain, and retire Black male teachers, by cultivating the skills of Black males as early as kindergarten, and coordinating institutional pathways for them to matriculate to and through the profession.
linkedin description: Black male teachers have shown to have the greatest impact on student achievement. But, they make up only 1.3% of the profession. To shift this, we need an earlier start and longer support. We see today‚Äôs Black male students as tomorrow‚Äôs Black male teachers. Our goal is for young Black males to discover teaching, then support them at every point on their path to and through the profession. We do this through direct programming and key partnerships. This is The Black Male Teacher Initiative. PreK- High School: In our I AM KING Program (IAK), we train and mentor Black male high school students to deliver social-emotional learning content to younger boys of color. College: Black male college students join our Fellowship in the summer, where they receive instructional support to teach middle school students. Fellows engage in Black male affinity groups during their experience. In the following school year, they have access to additional professional development and networking opportunities, including taking our Introduction to Education, Equity, and Identity course, taught online and accredited by the University of Massachusetts Lowell. He is Me pays for the course! Career: The Black Male Teacher Network is a virtual space for Black male teachers to connect, build community, and engage in identity-based professional development opportunities. Teachers are trained to facilitate affinity groups for their peers, college students, and high school students in our programs. Field-Building: The Building Black Male Teacher Pathways Summit convenes leaders in the education sector to reflect on their initiatives to inspire and support Black male teachers through collaboration. Our lifelong focus provides a clear pathway for Black males to become and remain teachers. As a result of our programs and partnerships, schools will recruit, retain, and retire more Black male teachers.
linkedin specialities: Teaching and Learning, Black Identity, Male Identity, Education, Mentorship, Leadership, social-emotional learning, SEL, training, development, teacher pipelines

summary: Founder and principal of Concrete Advisors, a boutique professional services firm providing strategic communications consulting and executive coaching. job description (4): Kissing peacocks, hula hoops and Corporate America‚Ä¶ Oh, where do I begin? I‚Äôve spent nearly 20-years in Corporate America doing everything from training, executive leadership, managing big box retail stores, owning my own consulting firm and even working in the coffee industry. In 2012, I decided to take a big risk and follow my heart; leaving Corporate America to launch Booya! Okay, this is where the peacock comes in. The Booya! bird was our mascot. You see peacocks remind us to laugh at life. They remind us that joy can be found inside our soul even during the most trying of times. Booya! was a joy movement. I started Booya! because I saw a desperate need for bringing energy, hope and light back to this world. This of course did not happen solo. There was an amazing team of people who shared the same passion for a better world. In fact, there were 100,000 people who shared our same passion. We had classes and events throughout the city all in the name of joy. We even brought together 1,000 hula hoopers to beat The World Book of Records. As you can imagine, the media caught on and the Booya! buzz was everywhere. People loved it! One thing led to another and I created a methodology that brought together the joy concept of Booya! and Corporate America. I pitched it, and I was DENIED. Over and over again. I was told, ‚ÄúGina, your ideas are way too progressive. Too far out there. It‚Äôll never work.‚Äù So I decided to write a book proving that a whole new world of business that‚Äôs good for people, profit and the Earth is possible. And Fuel Your Business was born. http://www.amazon.com/Fuel-Your-Business-Energize-Profits/dp/1601632967 This was only the beginning. In addition to business, my life work is spiritual wellness. Publishing my first book has enabled me to take my passion for spiritual wellness to the places that need it most‚Äìwork and school. One-by-one, I help people become their best SELF so we can walk forward together making the world a healthier place.

summary: I believe the future belongs to leaders who have the courage to be human.In a world where disruption, AI, and constant change have become the norm, too many leaders are still trying to apply outdated, technical fixes to what are really adaptive, human challenges. The result? Stressed-out leaders, disconnected teams, and cultures stuck in survival mode.My mission is to change that.I help leaders and organizations future-proof themselves by rehumanizing leadership ‚Äî building courageous, adaptive cultures where people can thrive, not just survive. Through a blend of neuroscience, systems thinking, and deep humanity, I equip people to upgrade their inner ‚Äúoperating systems,‚Äù lead with authenticity and calm, and navigate complexity with courage and purpose.As CEO of Salveo Partners, keynote speaker, and author of Future-Proofing Leadership and Rehumanizing the Workplace, I challenge outdated thinking, introduce better ways to grow people and organizations, and help leaders create ripple effects of lasting impact. Because the future of work isn‚Äôt about doing more ‚Äî it‚Äôs about becoming more.In an age of AI, algorithms, and accelerating change, human skills are your ultimate competitive advantage. job description: OUR WHY: To rehumanize the workplace so people can bring their best selves to work - and home - each day. WHO WE ARE: We envision a world where everyone can show up authentically, grow their potential and maximize their impact at work. Salveo Partners is a certified woman-owned, award-winning consulting firm founded in 2015. We future-proof organizations by strengthening culture and upskilling leaders and teams to show up courageously and better navigate change and disruption. We differentiate ourselves by taking an unparalleled, customized, comprehensive approach for both development and systems to address the root of what gets in the way of leaders and teams being fully effective in a disruptive world. Our three core services include: 1. Developing Future-Ready Leaders so they can upgrade their faulty human programming that is the underlying driver of behaviors and the impediments of leadership effectiveness, more effectively lead through change and develop courageous and high-performing teams. 2. Championing People-Centric Culture Change helps foster clarity and alignment with your purpose, strategy and goals while reducing regrettable turnover and enhancing engagement and the employee experience. 3. Implementing Transformational Speaking, Training & Facilitation Experiences that both inspires and provides clear, actionable steps to foster strategic clarity, enhance team cohesion, promote belonging and inclusion (particularly for younger generations entering the workforce), and support greater wellbeing. Our latest book, "Rehumanizing the Workplace" shows how organizations can restore hope, wellbeing and performance one team at a time and won a Reader's Favorite award. Check out a free sample chapter from our books as well as free white papers, blogs and resources on creating a thriving workplace culture at salveopartners.com

education school linkedin description (1: Throughout our history, the broad missions of teaching, research, and service have helped to guide the university and will continue to do so. However, as East Carolina University begins a new century, five specific dimensions of our mission will give sharper focus to our work. When considered in the context of our tradition, resources, and national reputation, these five areas provide the university with important opportunities for greater service and distinction in the coming decade. Assuring Access: Our resources and programs exist first and foremost to serve the people of North Carolina, especially as we shape the workforce of tomorrow. We are committed to a spirit of access to all the opportunities afforded by a major research and teaching university. We will develop and sustain programs that support this ideal. Supporting Student Success: Even as our research and extension enterprise grows, we remain committed to providing a great education in the classroom and to preparing tomorrow‚Äôs leaders through engagement, community service, and meaningful leadership experiences. Creating Opportunity for the East: No institution is more important to eastern North Carolina than East Carolina University. We will prepare tomorrow‚Äôs workforce, generate the intellectual capital that drives our economy, provide hands-on engagement with our region and state, and create new technologies from our research. Our Colleges of Business, Technology and Computer Science, and Fine Arts and Communication, as well as our health sciences schools, are significant drivers of the new economy. Forging Effective Partnerships: We are committed to building relationships with a wide range of partners for the benefit of the people of North Carolina. Responding to the Greatest Needs: The founding, growth, and continued success of East Carolina are all closely related to our effective response to the critical needs of communities and individuals.

summary: People & Culture Strategist | Organizational Effectiveness Advisor | Leader Whisperer I‚Äôm a seasoned People & Culture executive with 15+ years of experience transforming organizations, aligning talent strategies with business objectives, and building inclusive cultures that don‚Äôt burn people out. With leadership roles at UnitedHealth Group and Stanford Healthcare and as the founder of Be Kind Lyfe, I‚Äôve developed and executed strategies that improve performance, increase retention, and actually make work not feel like punishment (Happy Employees = Successful Workplaces). I lead with the ‚Äú1% Rule‚Äù‚Äîbecause meaningful, sustainable change doesn‚Äôt happen by flipping a table; it‚Äôs built one intentional step at a time. My work focuses on empowering leaders with confidence, executive presence, and influence‚Äîwithout trading in their soul or sanity. Highlights: ‚Ä¢ Increased leadership confidence 10X across executive cohorts. ‚Ä¢ Drove double-digit gains in employee engagement through culture redesign. ‚Ä¢ Reduced attrition by 3%+, stabilizing teams during periods of transition. ‚Ä¢ Boosted productivity by up to 10% while improving employee well-being. ‚Ä¢ Delivered strategic plans within 12 months, from concept to execution. I balance business acumen with humanity‚Äîan approach shaped by everything from Lean/Six Sigma to the quiet emotional depth of the band BTS (yes, really). Authenticity and self-care aren‚Äôt afterthoughts‚Äîthey‚Äôre leadership imperatives. Let‚Äôs connect if you: ‚Ä¢ Need a strategic partner to transform workplace culture. ‚Ä¢ Want to lead with more confidence (without burning out). ‚Ä¢ Are committed to driving engagement and retention at scale. ‚Ä¢ Believe kindness and performance are not mutually exclusive. summary: Your mission is powerful. But you just don't get social media? I know what it‚Äôs like to lead a mission-driven organization while trying to keep up with social media. In 2020, I was second in command at a $23M nonprofit operation, leading initiatives that impacted thousands. But when the pandemic shifted everything, I saw firsthand how challenging it was for organizations and speakers to cut through the noise, attract supporters, and turn followers into real advocates. I launched GPS, LLC in 2021 to make social media easy for folks like you. Most of us struggle with: ‚ÜíNot having enough time to manage social media effectively ‚ÜíFeeling stressed by algorithms and engagement strategies ‚ÜíExpanding beyond local reach to attract global supporters ‚ÜíTurning followers into true advocates and donors I understand your work is about impact, not spending hours creating content. That‚Äôs why I help mission-driven organizations simplify and systemize their social media so they can: ‚ÜíBuild an engaged community that cares about their cause ‚ÜíReach audiences worldwide without feeling overwhelmed ‚ÜíIncrease donations and funding opportunities ‚ÜíAnd save them tons of time! And I help using The SYNC Method! It's a refreshing approach to social media (and life) designed for mission-driven humans. Simple ‚Ü≥Focus on what truly matters instead of overcomplicating content. Yield to Your Intentions ‚Ü≥Align your strategy with serving your audience, not trends. Natural ‚Ü≥Show up authentically so they connect with the real you. Change It Up ‚Ü≥Keep your content fresh to maintain engagement and visibility. The framework is backed up by research, and if implemented correctly, it will transform your organization's online presence. If you‚Äôre ready to stop spinning your wheels and you want actual results, let‚Äôs connect.
linkedin description: Welcome to Gwinnett County ‚Äî one of America's fastest-growing counties for the past 20 years. Our dynamic and exciting county combines the best of big-city living with the comforts of the suburbs. The county's population in 2000 was about 588,448 and we‚Äôve only continued to grow since then, with more than a million residents now calling our county home. Gwinnett has many advantages, beginning with its location and road system. The county is just 45 minutes from Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport and 30 minutes from downtown Atlanta. Thanks to this location, 80 percent of the U.S. population is within a two-hour flight. Georgia Highway 316 has been extended to Athens, reducing travel time to the University of Georgia to 25 minutes. Gwinnett's infrastructure includes more than 2,750 miles of roadways to provide excellent mobility for our residents. The County Administrator and County Attorney are appointed by the Board of Commissioners and serve at its pleasure. To implement the Board's policy directives, the County Administrator uses a management team consisting of members of his immediate staff and 15 department directors. The 15 departments that make up the executive side are Police Services, Fire and Emergency Services, Corrections, Child Advocacy and Juvenile Services, Communications, Support Services, Financial Services, Community Services, Human Resources, Information Technology Services, Law, Parks and Recreation, Planning and Development, Water Resources, and Transportation. Each department is run by a director who is charged with managing operations efficiently and effectively. In addition to the executive side of County government, certain services are provided through Constitutional officers and independent elected officials. These external offices are created by the Georgia Constitution or through state law. In Gwinnett, they include the Sheriff, Tax Commissioner, District Attorney, Probate Court Judge, and Chief Magistrate.

linkedin description (2): GiANT is a global media and content development company specializing in leader transformation. Working in over 100 countries, our vision is to unlock the potential of people. We're here to take your leaders to higher levels. Our vision (or "heroic goal"‚Äã as we like to call it) is to raise up liberating leaders in every major city and every major sector of the world. To do this, we focus on 1) Increasing the number of secure leaders inside an organization 2) Raising the leadership capacity of those leaders, and 3) Accelerating the growth of the leadership culture of these organizations. At the heart of everything we do is apprenticeship. It's the secret sauce. For us, apprenticeship is all about intentional, long-term calibration of high support and high challenge, all within a small group environment. It is here where master craftsmen multiply their skills and expertise into the lives of those they are apprenticing. Rather than being an academic exercise, everything is applied learning. summary: The PSC (People Strategy Consulting) Team I lead provides "Workplace and People Solutions". I also serve as a Leadership/Career Coach for other consulting firms. Our PSC Team's expertise can help your company by: Coaching & Developing Leaders & Key Associates: Individual coaching for emerging, developing and strategic leaders, as well as, key individual contributors, in one of two ways: (1) One-on-one with a designated professional coach for a 3-9 month period, where a leadership development plan is created and implemented, or (2) by "Just-in-Time" Coaching allowing a leader to obtain a one time or multiple coaching session and support from a professional coach on a "as needed and confidential basis" for a specific issue or situation. Developing High Performance Teams and Engaging Employees: A customized Team Coaching process over a series of Team sessions is developed based upon issues and concerns the team has, as well as to address any Team dysfunctions, which all teams must overcome! summary: You didn‚Äôt start your business to run every department. You had a vision. You saw a better way to serve customers, lead people, and grow something meaningful. But somewhere along the way, you became the bottleneck. You‚Äôre stuck in the weeds. Solving problems you didn‚Äôt cause. Approving decisions you shouldn‚Äôt have to make. Every new hire or process adds complexity, not clarity. That‚Äôs where I come in. I help Visionaries like you build real businesses, not high-paying jobs. As a Fractional Integrator and COO, I step in as your Second-in-Command. I bring structure to the chaos, create clarity around roles, and build systems that keep your team moving forward without constant input from you. I‚Äôve spent 25+ years doing this across industries: tech, telecom, construction, service, distribution, and several others. I‚Äôve led teams as an VP of Operations, Integrator, President, and COO. Today, I work with companies between $2M and $50M who are scaling fast and feeling the pressure. Most are running on EOS¬Æ and have an Implementer‚Ñ¢ or graduated from one. Here‚Äôs how we work together: 1. Clarify the structure ‚Äì Clarify your Accountability Chart so everyone knows who owns what. 2. Install discipline ‚Äì Use tools like scorecards, Rocks, and Meeting Rhythms that actually get traction. 3. Free you to lead ‚Äì Remove you from day-to-day ops so you can stay in your zone of genius. When the right operational structure is in place, everything changes. You get your time back. Your team gets aligned. And your business becomes something you can grow, scale, or even sell. Let‚Äôs turn your company into the business you originally set out to build. Based in Fairhope, AL - Available Nationwide
job description: If your business feels more like a job than a company, we should talk. Most Founders/Visionaries hit a wall. Growth stalls, chaos creeps in, and the team needs clarity. You want to lead, but you‚Äôre buried in decisions, bottlenecks, and burnout. The business is running you and not the other way around. That‚Äôs where I come in. As a Fractional COO & Integrator for organizations running on EOS¬Æ, I partner with founder-led companies to: ‚Ä¢ Bring order to the chaos ‚Ä¢ Build structure that scales ‚Ä¢ Create clarity and accountability at every level ‚Ä¢ Drive execution so Visionaries can focus on vision If you‚Äôre running on EOS¬Æ, I step in to bridge the gap between your Visionary leadership and day-to-day execution. I work seamlessly with Implementers and help drive EOS¬Æ through the organization not just at the leadership team level. Not on EOS¬Æ yet? I bring proven operational systems from warehousing, telecom, tech, SaaS, and production to help you build a business you can run, not one that runs you. Already have an Integrator or COO? I coach leaders in those seats to help them build confidence, sharpen execution, and align better with their Visionary counterparts. Want your business to stop feeling like a treadmill? Let‚Äôs get your structure right.
job description (3): Fixers & Founders is a podcast about the partnership between visionary founders and the operators who help them turn ideas into lasting businesses. Every week, we sit down with fractional executives‚ÄîCOOs, CFOs, CMOs, integrators‚Äîand the founders they serve. Together, they share candid stories about what it takes to scale a business, fix broken systems, and keep the vision alive when the pressure mounts. The show explores the quiet, unglamorous side of leadership: Fixing what‚Äôs already screwed up. Aligning teams when politics and friction get in the way. Building systems that last longer than the next strategy deck. Holding the line when founders hit the wall. This isn‚Äôt theory or hype‚Äîit‚Äôs the real work of building and sustaining companies. We cut past the noise to show how fractional leaders step in with clarity, calm, and persistence to keep businesses moving forward. For founders: You‚Äôll hear how others in your seat have leaned on fractional executives to bring structure and sanity to growth. For fixers: You‚Äôll gain insight into how your peers create impact, earn trust, and navigate client relationships. At its core, Fixers & Founders is about partnership. Vision without structure burns out. Structure without vision dries up. But when founders and fixers work together‚Äîthe machine runs. üéôÔ∏è New episodes launching soon. Subscribe wherever you get your podcasts, or visit fixersandfounders.com.

education school linkedin description (3: The University of Delaware - a state assisted, privately chartered institution - is a Land Grant, Sea Grant, Space Grant and Carnegie Research University (very high research activity). summary: Fourteen years ago, I relearned how to walk. That experience is the foundation of my work today. It taught me what it truly takes to perform under max pressure. Now, I partner with organizations to help their people and teams in high-stakes, dynamic environments become totally unshakeable. My journey started during my recovery when I discovered a passion for the human side of performance. This led me to a stint in journalism, covering the inner workings of Major League Baseball player development for NPR. Being on the ground gave me a deep understanding of the complexity, ambiguity and risk that leaders and staff in pro sports and entertainment face every day. Then I launched my own practice, How We Won. Now I serve as the long-term strategic partner to talent at organizations in the most demanding industries, helping them build the personal and team resiliency to create winning leadership and cultures. I've delivered over 4,500 sessions to employees at top companies like Google, American Express and Warner Bros. Discovery. I‚Äôm a QE Executive Certified Coach and an ICF Professional Certified Coach (PCC) on track for my Master Coach (MCC) credential in 2026. I also have a B.S. in Psychology. I believe an individual's personal strength and health are the most important drivers of an organization‚Äôs success. ‚ÄúKim is more than a coach. She's a strategic partner. She has a unique ability to help you peel back the layers of complex, multi-faceted challenges until you find the core issue. I went into our work feeling overwhelmed and left with a profound sense of clarity and peace. She doesn't just help you solve problems. She helps you see that you were never broken to begin with.‚Äù - VP, Global Partnerships at a Fortune 100 Company My services are optimized for organizational needs and include: Trainings, Workshops and Coaching (Executive, Team, Leadership, Onboarding, Career Path, Shadowing).

summary: Shawn is a seasoned lawyer with an entrepreneurial spirit & is experienced working with technology-focused organizations at varying stages, including as General Counsel for an international health tech company. Shawn works closely with clients as a valued & trusted advisor, providing business ready solutions to resolve issues revolving around incident response (breach coach), strategic risk, crisis, data privacy & cybersecurity. Shawn Ford provides strategic risk advisory services that span a comprehensive spectrum, encompassing strategic communications, investigations, due diligence, supply chain analysis, intelligence research & a range of specialized services. He provides guidance on issues related to kidnap, extortion, blackmail & product contamination, rendering invaluable support to High Net Worth Individuals & Families in need of protection & emergency response. He focuses on providing executive-level strategies to plan for, prevent, & respond to crises throughout the pre-, intra-, & post-crisis stages. Shawn values aiding clients to develop & build upon their understanding of strategic risk, compliance, privacy & cyber obligations. As such, he realizes first-hand the challenges that organizations face when trying to balance their compliance obligations while innovating & developing new products & services. Shawn helps companies turn their obligations into opportunities, to build trust & advance their business goals. Shawn assists multinational institutions to understand & operationalize their risk, privacy & cyber requirements. He works closely with the executives, CISOs & legal counsel to create enterprise-wide strategic risk programs, third party risk programs & incident response capabilities. He frequently works with privacy officers to implement their privacy program & to understand their data. As Co-Founder & President of IronGate Protection, Shawn leads the business as it provides executive & close protection, security operations, private investigation, bodyguard, residential security, threat assessment, & international operation management. Shawn states that his mission is ‚Äúto take a 360¬∞ approach to understand your organization‚Äôs position & ability to leverage strategic risk, data security, privacy & technology best practices to build brand trust & resiliency.‚Äù __ The content shared is for general informational purposes only & should not be construed as legal advice. Do not provide confidential information via LinkedIn as it may not be treated as confidential, privileged, or protected. Prior results do not guarantee similar outcome.

job description: As the lead incident response lawyer, provide strategic advice and project management as a breach coach in the event of a cybersecurity/data security incident, including cross-border incidents. Our team‚Äôs deep understanding of legal frameworks & business strategies allows us to provide proactive, resilient, & practical solutions that exceed expectations. Whether you're dealing with critical infrastructure, managing sensitive data, or navigating the complexities of AI, Ceiba Law ensures your operations remain secure, compliant, & competitive. Our Approach: We believe in fostering long-term partnerships based on trust, transparency, & a thorough understanding of our clients‚Äô needs. education school linkedin description (1: The official page of Osgoode Hall Law School of York University. Osgoode Hall Law School is located in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. It is one of the professional faculties at York University. Named after the first Chief Justice of Ontario, William Osgoode, the law school was established by The Law Society of Upper Canada in 1889 and was the only accredited law school in Ontario until 1957. Osgoode Hall Law School is consistently ranked as one of the top law schools in Canada by Maclean's Magazine. The law school is home to the Law Reform Commission of Ontario, the Osgoode Hall Law Journal, the German Law Journal, and the largest law library in the Commonwealth. Osgoode Hall Law School students may participate in a number of clinical and intensive programs, including the Community and Legal Aid Services Program (CLASP), the Poverty Law Intensive at Parkdale Community Legal Services, the Criminal Law Intensive, the Innocence Project, and the Osgoode Business Clinic. According to the Official Guide to Canadian Law Schools, Osgoode Hall Law School has the most extensive range of clinical programs in Canada. The primary student government at Osgoode is the Legal and Literary Society. Per jus ad justitiam: Through law to justice.

Our undergraduate courses in law, business, criminology, computer science and psychology have been specially designed to give you an exciting, practical academic experience, teaching you real-world skills so that you can achieve your ambitions. With our postgraduate law, business, psychology, computer science and education courses we strive to deliver outstanding academic and employment-focused education to help you hone your skills and graduate with the experience that will set you up for success. summary: I am a versatile leader with 30 years of experience in public policy and operations, a proven ability to leverage data to drive efficiency and manage multi-million dollar programs, and a strong background in government, nonprofits, and relationship management. Core Specialties: ‚Ä¢ Operations: Strategic Planning, Team Building, Project Management, Change Management, Process Re-engineering, Facilitation, Mediation ‚Ä¢ Data & Analytics: Impact Assessment, Analytics Strategy, Data Visualization (BI), Data Governance, Data Quality, Knowledge Management ‚Ä¢ Education Policy: Education Analytics, ESEA, P-16 Initiatives, College Readiness, Educator Preparation, Indian Education, Assessment & Accountability As founder of Greater for Good, I help nonprofits amplify their impact, drawing from 20+ years of experience in policy and analytics. I use my mediation and facilitation skills to help organizations define clear, actionable strategies. My expertise has led to: ‚úî Statewide longitudinal data systems for three state education agencies ‚úî Education accountability plans for all 50 states ‚úî A federal agency data governance knowledge portal ‚úî A $10,000 fundraising campaign for the Capital Area Food Bank Excellence is my standard. I aim high and persist until I deliver a top-tier product‚Äîan approach that has earned me repeat business. I am a collaborative leader. Each colleague brings unique value. I invest in each team member‚Äôs strengths to build high-performing teams that drive success for individuals and the organization alike. Rooted in Altruism, Empathy & Resourcefulness Growing up on a small ranch as one of 22 children‚Äîmost adopted from difficult backgrounds‚ÄîI learned adaptability, empathy, and problem-solving. job description (2): I partner with nonprofit and public sector organizations to enhance their effectiveness in fulfilling their missions. While I offer an array of services, my primary offering is fractional Chief Impact Officer services. For a more complete listing of services I provide, see https://greaterforgood.com/services/. As founder and president of Greater for Good, I manage all affairs of the business and ensure my consultancy is successful in its mission of expanding the reach of altruistic work.
linkedin description (2): Greater for Good offers nonprofits the services of a fractional chief impact officer (CIO) without their having to bear the full-time cost of an experienced executive. The part-time CIO's work enhances impact, informs management and services, attracts donors and volunteers, and frees up other staff to work on programming, fundraising, and advancing the organization's mission. Altruistic organizations labor for a brighter world. Greater for Good helps them reach it. This consultancy amplifies the work of nonprofits by facilitating positive change, increasing impact, and applying smart management principles. Making the world better is no easy job. Over 1.5 million nonprofits are hard at work to do it. Greater for Good works with you to articulate your specific needs and then craft and implement a solution that advances the good you do. In addition to Fractional CIO services, we offer: Facilitation Get the most from your meetings via a trained facilitator who sets clear objectives, keeps discussions on track, and enables you to identify and take the next steps to advancement. . Strategic Planning and Implementation Achieving greatness isn't accidental. You need a well-defined mission, clear goals, and a smart strategy that delivers attainment. We also provide the plan and project management to transform talk to action and achievement. Program Definition and Implementation When you discover a new way to further your cause, call on us to help you design your new program for sustainability and measurable effectiveness. Process Re-engineering Your resources are precious. Make the most of them by eliminating wasteful practices. We can help! Organizational Assessment We provide an objective analysis of your organizational health and how to eliminate weaknesses. Data Strategy We enable you to leverage your data for good. Team Building We use data to design activities to strengthen your team while having fun! Contact darla@greaterforgood.com to learn more.

education school linkedin description (1: Texas A&M University has a proud history that stretches back to 1876 when The Agricultural and Mechanical College of Texas became the first public institution of higher learning in the state of Texas. Nestled in the heart of the Houston-Dallas-Austin triangle, Texas A&M University at College Station is the state's largest university, with nearly 77,000 students calling Aggieland home, and another 5,200 Aggies are studying at branch campuses in Galveston, Texas, and Doha, Qatar. Texas A&M's designation as a land-, sea-, and space-grant institution reflects the superior quality and diverse range of research and innovation occurring on campus daily. Texas A&M boasts a strong military tradition, having contributed men and women in uniform to every armed conflict since the Spanish-American War. More Aggies commission as officers into the U.S. Armed Forces than any other school outside of the U.S. military academies every year. Student-athletes represent Texas A&M across 18 sports within the Southeastern Conference. Additionally, the George H.W. Bush Presidential Library and Museum is located on Texas A&M's campus, as is the President and First Lady‚Äôs final resting places. Quick to offer a cheery "Howdy!"‚Äã to any visitor, Aggies pride themselves on their hospitality and strive to live out the University's core values of respect, excellence, leadership, loyalty, integrity, and selfless service. To learn more about employment opportunities at Texas A&M, visit https://jobs.tamu.edu/.
