summary: By the age of 22, I'd: - Founded 4 businesses and sold 1 - Founded 2 non-profits and been program director at a 3rd - Directly mentored 300+ young entrepreneurs - Been appointed to faculty of an Ivy League University - Published 2 books Naturally, when I graduated from Brown, I had no interest in getting a job. But I had to make a living, so I founded a marketing agency. I worked with B2B service businesses, and promised them what everyone does. More marketing means: - More leads - More clients - More revenue Long story short, that didn't happen. I wasn't getting results because my approach was wrong. I noticed: Like most businesses, when B2B service firms want more clients, they invest in marketing. They chase cold leads, lose a ton of money, and wonder why nothing's working. So rather than being yet another run-of-the-mill marketing agency, I pivoted. Now, I build infrastructure to get more referrals. Why? It's the cheapest, fastest, and most effective way for a B2B service firm to grow. WHAT I BUILD: Referable Brand ‚Üí Positioning and messaging so clients know exactly who to refer to you Validation-Ready Digital Presence ‚Üí Website and LinkedIn optimized for referral confidence, not SEO traffic Relationship CRM ‚Üí Automated touchpoints that keep your network warm and generate systematic referrals WHO THIS IS FOR: Established B2B service firms ($500K-$5M) with 20+ client relationships but no system to leverage them. Consulting firms, agencies, coaches. WHY REFERRALS ARE BETTER: - They convert 71% higher than paid leads - They close 69% faster - Retention rates are 37% higher You might worry about being dependent on referrals. Odds are, you're not dependent ENOUGH. I've built infrastructure for 20+ clients in the past year‚Äîcreative agencies, solo consultants, coaches, EOS implementers, even a catering company. Ready to do what ACTUALLY works? Book a free 60-minute strategy session. I'll tell you how to sign 5 new clients without spending a dime. (It's not magic, it's referrals)
job description: I help B2B founders build client acquisition systems rooted in relationships, not lead generation. Services: - CRM design & implementation (built for trust, not tracking) - LinkedIn & outreach strategy (conversations, not cold pitching) - Marketing automation (that feels human) - Fractional CMO services Approach: Unlike traditional consultants who hand you templates, I design custom systems based on the psychology of relationships. This leads to 3x more referrals, 37% higher retention, and businesses founders actually love running. Who I work with: B2B founders, consultants, agencies, and service providers tired of pushy sales tactics.
linkedin description: At Scurry Consulting, we help entrepreneurs build better businesses by designing simple, effective systems that support sustainable growth. We work with founders who have vision, traction, and drive‚Äîbut lack the structure to scale with confidence. We specialize in three things: 1. Sales Funnels that Convert 2. CRMs that Work for You 3. Strategic Plans that Clarify What to Do Next Founded by Mason Scurry at 22, Scurry Consulting is not your average consulting firm. We‚Äôre not slow, corporate, or bloated. We‚Äôre fast, focused, and deeply invested in your success. Mason‚Äôs journey started early: ‚Äì At 16, he co-founded a nonprofit and built a team of 120 volunteers in two weeks. ‚Äì At 18, he accidentally launched a business that was acquired within two years. ‚Äì At 21, he published his second book. And during his final semester at Brown University, he made the call to skip the safe path and build Scurry Consulting from scratch. No stability. No safety net. Just a commitment to help others build meaningful, profitable companies. Within four months: ‚Äì 10 clients signed ‚Äì 2 interns hired ‚Äì $7,000/month in pre-commission revenue The systems that got him there are the same ones we now implement for clients. Our work is grounded in strategy, not fluff. We don‚Äôt sell shiny templates or one-size-fits-all solutions. We dig deep into how your business actually works, and then we help you design better ways to sell, serve, and scale. We work best with founders who are willing to think hard, work fast, and challenge their own assumptions. People who want clarity, not just clicks. People who want to move forward, not spin their wheels. If you‚Äôre that kind of founder, we‚Äôd love to work with you. Let‚Äôs build something that lasts.

job description (2): Appointed as an Adjunct Lecturer in Engineering by Brown University, I support executive graduate students in the Master of Technology Leadership (MTL) program through individualized and small-group communication coaching. I work with a cohort of 12 students to strengthen their executive presence, persuasive communication, and strategic messaging skills. This includes leading in-person coaching sessions during the program‚Äôs fall residency, providing virtual 1:1 coaching throughout the term, and offering structured feedback on recorded and live presentations. I focus on helping students apply communication theory to high-stakes professional settings while serving as a liaison between the instructional team and students to support growth and performance across the course.
linkedin description (2): Located in historic Providence, Rhode Island and founded in 1764, Brown University is the seventh-oldest college in the United States. Brown is an independent, coeducational Ivy League institution comprising undergraduate and graduate programs, plus the Alpert Medical School, School of Public Health, School of Engineering, and the School of Professional Studies. With its talented and motivated student body and accomplished faculty, Brown is a leading research university that maintains a particular commitment to exceptional undergraduate instruction. Brown‚Äôs vibrant, diverse community consists of about 6,200 undergraduates, 2,000 graduate students, 490 medical school students, more than 5,000 summer, visiting, and online students, and over 700 faculty members. Brown students come from all 50 states and more than 115 countries. Undergraduates pursue bachelor‚Äôs degrees in more than 70 concentrations, ranging from Egyptology to cognitive neuroscience. Anything‚Äôs possible at Brown‚Äîthe university‚Äôs commitment to undergraduate freedom means students must take responsibility as architects of their courses of study. Brown University has 51 doctoral programs and 28 master‚Äôs programs. The broad scope of options vary from interdisciplinary opportunities in molecular pharmacology and physiology to a master‚Äôs program in acting and directing through the Brown/Trinity Repertory Consortium. Around the world, nearly 90,000 Brown alumni are - in the words of Brown‚Äôs charter - leading lives of ‚Äúusefulness and reputation‚Äù in every imaginable field of endeavor. Through events around the globe, reunions on campus, career resources, a host of online connections, and other services, the Brown Alumni Association fosters and supports a vibrant alumni community, wherever its members may be.

summary: Do you often hire the wrong leaders? Have you wasted time and money on leadership development that produces no results? summary: I‚Äôve always believed that every difference‚Äîwhether in perspective, background, or approach‚Äîholds the potential for connection and transformation. That belief has shaped my two-decade journey as a leadership consultant, certified coach, and intercultural expert. Along the way, I‚Äôve had the privilege of partnering with organizations to foster inclusive, collaborative, and high-performing cultures that drive engagement, innovation, and sustainable success. My career is rooted in a simple yet powerful philosophy: resolving differences leads to redefining leadership. From navigating complex organizational challenges to coaching executives, my work is guided by a structured process I call the Reconciliation Method‚Ñ¢. This approach bridges diverse perspectives into cohesive strategies, delivering solutions that are not only actionable but authentically aligned with an organization‚Äôs values. Whether I‚Äôm facilitating cultural audits, optimizing team dynamics, or coaching leaders to connect their values with their actions, I aim to help organizations thrive by putting people at the heart of their success. Over the years, I‚Äôve led the design and global expansion of DEIB strategies, cultivated growth-oriented, human-centered cultures, and created frameworks for alignment that endure. My process is both data-driven and deeply empathetic, ensuring every recommendation is practical, sustainable, and meaningful. I specialize in leadership development, organizational alignment, and creating cultural transformation that sticks. When I‚Äôm not immersed in bridging gaps and aligning leadership values, you‚Äôll often find me exploring new cities, indulging in the rich history and local cuisine that each place has to offer. As a firm believer in the power of connection, I also cherish moments spent with friends and family‚Äîwhether at a lively dinner table or a serene outdoor retreat. My mission is clear: to help leaders and teams unlock their full potential, fostering cultures where collaboration isn‚Äôt just a goal‚Äîit‚Äôs the standard. Ready to take the next step in building alignment and creating a thriving culture? Let‚Äôs connect and explore how we can turn differences into opportunities for transformation and success.

summary: Carol is a transformative executive coach, strategic advisor and consultant whose 30+ year career has been defined by an unwavering commitment to helping people, teams and organizations unlock their fullest potential. She has a rare blend of operational acumen, cultural intelligence, and instinct for transformation and turns complex ideas into actionable insights, asking tough and helpful questions, and creating positive environments where dialogue drives progress. Carol has navigated complexity of large-scale change, leading with empathy, clarity and a result-oriented mindset. She has led, mentored and sponsored thousands of diverse leaders and teams as they faced into and progressed successfully through change. With a professional foundation laid at Johnson & Johnson, Carol served in multiple VP, Human Resources/Management Board roles in Pharmaceuticals, Consumer Products, and Medical Technology. She provided trusted counsel to leaders in and across Commercial, R&D, Supply Chain, and Corporate functions. Carol built/led high performing, diverse HR teams in Business Partner and Specialist roles including Global Leadership Development and D&I. Carol is President of New Hope Coaching where she partners with individuals, professional service providers and global, large/mid-scale companies in Pharmaceuticals, Biotech, Consumer, Retail, Manufacturing, and Provider/Delivery. She is curious, learns quickly, and is interested in new business segments. Carol delivers 1:1 executive coaching for Presidents, /S-VPs, and Sr. Directors in an array of discipline areas, in addition to executive leadership team advising/consulting. M.S. in Organizational Development from American University/NTL Certified: Board Certified Coach (BCC), Center for Executive Coaching, CEC Team Coaching, Hogan Leadership Assessments, Prosci Change Management Carol thrives on meaningful connections with family, friends, and colleagues, loves animals, enjoys discovering new places, meeting new people, and playing a fun round of golf. Her belief in the power of people, the promise of potential and the beauty of possibility is not just a mission statement ‚Äì it‚Äôs how she lives, leads and inspires others.

summary: A recognized B2B growth expert and coach, I help B2B leaders accelerate & de-risk growth through strategic market innovation. CONTACT ME for a complimentary consultation at 216.333.4569 or Kelly@LawrenceInnovation.com. I'm the one people call to deliver new business growth. With over 20 years of experience spanning Fortune 500 companies, privately held businesses, and startups, I'm grateful to have partnered with global leaders and coached hundreds of team members to drive top and bottom-line growth while unlocking new business opportunities: strategy to execution. I strive for continuous learning, so it's an honor to serve as a contributing author to WhatTheyThink, an AIM Institute coach and Innoquest community member. I've enjoyed the learning that has come from authoring globally recognized market reports and working with global teams over the years. I am thrilled to share insights with others who share the vision of improving organic growth processes and results. When you choose to work with me, you gain a partner who cares about growing your business just as much as you do. Specializing in strategic market innovation, my boutique advisory firm helps B2B leaders de-risk and accelerate organic growth for long-term sustainable business results. My approach is recognized for delivering value-driven partnerships and measurable ROI. I am humbled that my clients who collectively represent over $120 billion in annual revenue, partner with me to solve real-world problems that make a significant impact. ORGANIC GROWTH EXPERTISE From initial market assessment through demand creation, I help you analyze your unique situation and develop practical action plans to accelerate organic growth. I also help teams build stronger competency in front-end-of innovation processes for higher hit rates. Before founding Lawrence Innovation, I delivered impactful innovation results at Fortune Brands' Moen and Berkshire Hathaway's Lubrizol. My teams typically have a hit rate upwards of 60% versus industry averages of under 5%. What would it do for you if you could improve your hit rate by 10x? MY VISION Walt Disney said, "If you dream it, you can do it." I say, of course you can, but make sure it matters to your customers before you build it. MAKING IT MATTER Passionate about making the world a better place, I live and play in Greater Cleveland, Ohio with my husband and two daughters - my why. I relish learning new things. Hobbies include traveling, standup paddle boarding, hiking with my pal Zeke (English Black Labrador), baking, & reading.
job description: Lawrence Innovation, LLC helps B2B leaders accelerate & de-risk growth through strategic market innovation. Our tailored services are designed to deliver sustainable growth from strategy to execution with a proven framework. We and our partners provide end-to-end-strategic-marketing support from fuzzy front-end-of-innovation opportunity analysis to value delivery through: Consulting: Opportunity analysis, value proposition clarity, and go-to-market strategy to seize new growth opportunities. Training: Build internal excellence with our training programs in Strategic Marketing, Innovation, and Value Selling. Coaching & Facilitation: Executive coaching, strategic planning, and de-risking facilitation to sharpen decision-making and execution. Fractional Support: On-demand strategic marketing and new business development expertise when you need it most. Our clients learn how to stay in touch with customers through deep dialogue, develop the right offers, develop and communicate unique value propositions and nail a profitable business model with proven revenue streams. When you work with us, you get high caliber strategic marketing and business development as a variable cost. We operate as an independent consultancy with strategic alliances for zero overhead. This means you get real business growth expertise and the tools of a large firm at significantly lower costs with greater flexibility versus hiring full-time employees. We bring direct experience across B2B industries including: digital printing, textiles, packaging, chemicals, building products and C-level education in financial services. Contact us when you are ready to scale or need to pivot.

summary: As a strategic advisor, coach, and consultant, I help business owners, founders, and managing partners simplify complexity, create clarity, and drive sustainable growth. I work with professional service firms, consumer product brands, manufacturing businesses, construction companies, and technology firms to develop and implement actionable strategies that fuel revenue growth, enhance profitability, and build high-performing teams. WHY MY EXPERIENCE MATTERS TO YOUR BUSINESS: I spent my career leading marketing, sales, and business development for well-known consumer brands and manufacturing firms. While my expertise began in consumer-driven industries, the principles of growth, positioning, and strategy apply universally and are just as critical for professional service firms as they are for consumer brands. Professional service firms struggle with differentiation, client acquisition, and scaling. Consumer brands focus on creating emotional connections, brand loyalty, and effective go-to-market strategies. My expertise blends both, helping professional service firms apply consumer-driven insights to win more business while guiding consumer brands to develop lasting market impact. HOW I HELP: ‚úî Growth Strategy & Positioning ‚Äì Establishing a compelling market position that drives demand and revenue. ‚úî Leadership & Team Optimization ‚Äì Helping owners develop leadership skills, structure strong teams, and build a results-driven culture. ‚úî Sales & Marketing Acceleration ‚Äì Driving lead generation, conversion, and long-term customer engagement. ‚úî Business Efficiency & Financial Strategy ‚Äì Identifying key operational efficiencies to improve profitability and scale effectively. ‚úî Exit & Transition Planning ‚Äì Preparing businesses for leadership transitions, mergers, or sales to maximize value. REAL RESULTS, REAL IMPACT: ‚úÖ Transformed professional service firms by refining messaging, improving operations, and increasing client acquisition. ‚úÖ Led go-to-market strategies that drove multimillion-dollar growth for national and global consumer brands. ‚úÖ Revitalized declining industries through strategic branding and marketing that increased market share and profitability. ‚úÖ Helped business owners scale and exit by positioning their companies for sustainable growth and maximum valuation. summary: I'm Kat, a Finnish-American ICF-certified executive and leadership team coach, facilitator, and speaker with 25+ years of experience in global organizational and leadership development. I help leaders and organizations create a culture of inclusion and psychological safety where innovation thrives. My master‚Äôs degree in Mental Health Counseling informs my holistic, research-backed coaching framework. Together, we explore new perspectives and identify solutions for growth and success as well as health and well-being. In 1998, I moved from my native Finland to New York City. I was the first in my family to earn a college degree and, like many others, I craved the energy, inspiration, and diversity of life in NYC. I held career services and HR & development roles before founding my independent coaching practice. My expertise lies in international and highly-demanding professional contexts‚Äîsince founding my practice, my work has taken me to Helsinki, Rome, Bangkok, and Bonn and I‚Äôve worked with leaders based across six continents. Sisu‚Äîthe Finnish concept of resilience‚Äîand my own personal experiences as an immigrant have deeply influenced my coaching philosophy. My approach to coaching is built upon a core belief in our human capacity to learn and grow, to succeed through challenges, and live and lead with purpose. Alongside my coaching practice, I am an experienced senior non-profit founder and board leader. I have founded, led, and developed several global and local non-profit community organizations over the past 30 years. After I moved to NYC, I founded two non-profit organizations with and for Nordic women. I have served as vice-president for a global non-profit FIGT.org, and the local Finnish American Chamber of Commerce in NYC. I led the Chatham High School Marching Band Club, a registered 501c3, as President for several years. As a leader, I am driven by my values to make a difference by strengthening communities through engagement. In all my leadership experiences, I have improved the performance and structure of the board‚ÄîI am a skilled organizer known for getting things done. I lead with a strong vision and clear goals while building engagement and motivation through communication and relationship building. Want to learn more about working with me as your executive or team coach and facilitator? Send me a note!

summary: I am passionate about helping businesses bring their product visions to life. With over 25 years of experience in product development, manufacturing, and sourcing, I have had the privilege of working with leading brands across North America, helping them create and launch successful product lines from start to finish. As the founder of InterConcept Inc. and Menn√§ Life, I have guided numerous businesses through the complexities of sourcing, design, and production, ensuring they have high-quality products that resonate with their target audience. From concept development and private labeling to global sourcing and manufacturing logistics, I provide comprehensive solutions that make the entire process seamless. In addition, I act as a local agent for overseas manufacturing, bridging the gap between brands and international suppliers. I ensure that every step of the process‚Äîfrom sourcing materials to final production‚Äîis handled with precision and care, providing you with peace of mind that your product is being developed efficiently and to the highest standards. Whether you're an emerging startup looking to develop your first product or an established brand seeking to expand your line, I offer the expertise, network, and strategic insight needed to deliver results. In addition to my product development work, I am also a certified life coach specializing in energy healing. I teach individuals how to access their inner world of energy awareness and use this awareness to self-discover their outer material world. If you're not using energy consciously, you're only living with half of yourself. My coaching empowers clients to live fully, aligning their personal and professional lives for lasting balance and fulfillment. Let‚Äôs work together to create something extraordinary for your brand. Reach out today to discuss how I can support your product development journey or personal growth.
job description: Coaching is the bridge between where you are now and where you want to be‚Äîa powerful tool for creating real, lasting change. While change is inevitable, we often resist the unknown. Everyone has unique abilities, interests, and talents, but sometimes it‚Äôs hard to recognize them within ourselves. My coaching process focuses on aligning your goals with your true purpose, starting from within. summary: Strategy breaks down when conditions change faster than plans. My role is to slow thinking down just enough to create clarity ‚Äî and then help people move forward with confidence. summary: Founders reach out to me when their team isn‚Äôt working the way it should and avoiding it is no longer an option. The business has grown, but roles are unclear, accountability is inconsistent, and performance issues are being tolerated instead of addressed. Managers aren‚Äôt managing. Founders are stuck in the middle, dealing with people problems they shouldn‚Äôt be carrying. I step in to fix that. I‚Äôm an executive HR partner who works with founders and leadership teams as they grow. I help leaders make decisions about their people, set expectations that actually stick, and put structure in place so the same problems don‚Äôt keep coming back. Clients bring me in to: Address underperformance directly Define roles, ownership, and decision rights Hold leaders and managers accountable Have hard conversations and move on from them Build people systems that work at the company‚Äôs current size Sometimes that‚Äôs retained executive HR support. Sometimes it‚Äôs a leadership reset, offsite, or retreat. Either way, the outcome is the same. People know what they‚Äôre responsible for. Decisions get made. Founders stop acting as the default HR department. If your team isn‚Äôt working and you‚Äôre tired of circling the same issues, I‚Äôm usually the call that helps leaders deal with it properly.

summary: With a doctorate in clinical psychology and extensive studies, experience, and practice in corporate coaching and consultancy, Dr. Andy Garrett is at the forefront of a revolutionary movement towards personal growth and optimization. He earned his doctoral degree from the Graduate Psychology program at Azusa Pacific University. Their theoretical emphasis on Systems theory and unique holistic integration philosophy helped him to become very effective in conceptualizing and implementing strategic growth plans for individuals, families, and corporations. Dr. Andy uniquely emphasizes a positive psychology approach that utilizes established individual, familial, and organizational strengths rather than underscoring what may be pathological or dysfunctional. In blending this approach with a systems theoretical model, existential psychology, and solution-focused strategies, he's empowered to provide a transformative brand of coaching and consulting. Throughout his career, he‚Äôs contributed a significant and meaningful role as a consultant for multiple faith-based organizations - where he specializes in empowering his clients to discover and establish their True North identity, purpose, and community - and then integrate radically resilient principles, practices, and strategies - that enable his clients to consistently achieve their biggest goals and actualize their greatest potential. Dr. Andy has made a considerable impact working as a performance coach for high performing executives, elite athletes, and organizations throughout Southern California - and beyond (his online coaching curriculum has been effectively utilized and taught throughout the US - and even in select European countries). Dr. Andy has developed a thriving private practice in the renowned Newport Beach area, and he offers custom private workshops, corporate training programs, he is a highly sought after speaker and podcast guest, and he continues to offer concierge style coaching services (although - openings with Dr. Andy are rare to come by - so, if you are interested in working with him one on one - you should get on his waiting list ASAP!).

job description (3): Providing clinical services for children, adolescents, adults, geriatrics, couples, and families in an outpatient private practice setting. Therapeutic interventions included individual therapy (CBT, client-centered, and/or IPT), group therapy, didactic therapy, couples and family counseling.
job description (4): Thank you for taking the opportunity to get to know me and my approach to psychotherapy. My name is Andy Garrett (my patient‚Äôs typically refer to me as Dr. G or Dr. Andy) and I am excited to be joining the Connolly Counseling Group practice. As a clinician ‚Äì I believe that therapy should help you access the best part of yourself, enhance the overall quality and sense of satisfaction in your life, and remove the emotional barriers that are holding you back from achieving your goals. In this process you will gain the capacity and confidence to establish relationships that are meaningful, fulfilling, and lasting. Over the course of completing my doctoral studies and clinical training at Azusa Pacific University ‚Äì I developed a unique style of psychotherapy which has proven to be highly effective. I have worked in some of the most reputable psychiatric hospitals, outpatient clinics, educational institutions, and private practice settings in Southern California. These opportunities have allowed me the privilege of working with a diverse population of adolescents, adults, couples, and families. I have developed specific interests and training in treating psychological issues that include anxiety, depression, life transitions, addictions (including substance abuse related issues, food addictions, and compulsive gambling), faith/religious distress, and grief. I can also provide psychological testing services for diagnostic purposes, academic testing, premarital enrichment, and occupational enhancement. In summary, it would be my privilege to join you on your journey towards self-discovery and personal growth. In the process you will experience a collaborative relationship that is both supportive and affirming‚Äìand I will help you achieve the absolute best quality of life that you truly deserve. In taking that courageous first step and reaching out for help, you can change the course of your life forever‚Ä¶and for the better! Supervisor: Bob Connolly, Psy.D.

summary: Hi, I'm Racheal üëãüèº (yes, my name is misspelled... more on that in a bit). I've been a professional copywriter for 14 years. It's a specialized method for uncovering truth through conversation‚Äîturns out it's incredibly useful for understanding what your audience actually needs to hear. Award-winning copywriter. 14 years and $20M+ in traceable client revenue. I've tested what works, learned what doesn't, and refined my approach across industries, offer types, and business stages. job description: The Messaging Lab: An Award-Winning (Human) Copywriter on Retainer (for just $97 per month - no contract) You've spent hours staring at your sales page, rewriting the same line, wondering why it's not landing. You've asked for feedback and gotten "looks good!" from your friendly neighborhood ChatGPT. You've tried the frameworks. You know something's off, but you can't see it anymore. I can look at it and tell you in five minutes. Want me to prove it? Send me a DM with your sales page link, and I'll send you back a Loom with at least three changes to make RIGHT NOW to increase conversions. Not because I'm smarter than you - because I've been doing this for 14 years and I've seen every version of "stuck" there is. The hook buried in paragraph three. The CTA that's asking for too much too soon. The copy that's talking about features when it should be talking about the moment right before they buy. That's what you're getting here. Not templates. Not a course you watch alone. A trained set of eyes on YOUR copy, YOUR launches, YOUR offers - as often as you need them. Submit your copy, I revise it personally with tracked changes and notes. summary: I'm a builder - businesses, teams, and yes, even the physical structures themselves back in the day. It started from the time I was a kid, when I developed a fascination with downtowns - the interesting collections of buildings right next to each other with so many diverse activities going on inside them. When I began to see my downtown emptying out, like so many others, I knew I wanted to be a part of saving it, rebuilding it, and bringing it back to life. At first I took that literally - going to school to study architecture and engineering to revitalize and repurpose historic buildings. Later, I realized that I could have an additional impact by being a part of getting new business energy into those spaces for revitalization and growth. Fast forward to today, I have a two-pronged approach to support business: guiding companies as they come into existence, and also advising business how to operate efficiently so they stay in existence. From Main Street businesses to Fortune 500 corporations, and from incubators/accelerators to economic development agencies, my clients have benefited from interacting with me and my teams for over a decade. In addition to a substantial library of operations know-how, key tools in my leadership toolbox are: actively listening to constituents and 360-degree awareness of everyone in the ecosystem; circumspection while clearly seeing all points of view; and optimizing a strategic win-win outcome that can be operationally executed by a balance of guidance and inclusion of all stakeholders. Contact me if you'd like to build (or re-build!) something great together.

job description: It's your business. Your profit should come first! I am not your typical business coach or consultant, I am a Business Builder and Certified Profit First Professional. summary: I‚Äôm passionate about promoting entrepreneurship, economic development, and community engagement in Detroit. My expertise and research primarily focuses on the impact of support organizations such as workforce training and development programs, accelerators, incubators, co-working spaces, startup studios, corporate innovation initiatives and community building events. My strategic consultancy helps nonprofits, startups, and mission-driven businesses transform their vision into sustainable impact and scale with confidence. Projects span strategic operations, program design, talent development, community activation and growth strategy. Alongside this work, I enjoy coaching founders, mentoring emerging leaders, and teaching the next generation of entrepreneurs. I also am a Lecturer at University of Michigan teaching Negotiation to undergrads. I am Co-founder and Partner of Venture Catalysts, a nonprofit focused on building an inclusive entrepreneurial ecosystem in Detroit through events like Detroit Startup Week (10,000+ attendees), AfroTech (largest black tech conference), and Backstage Capital Accelerator (investing in underrepresented, or rather underestimated, founders). Previously I was the Head of Founder Network and Operations for Tenney 110, a portfolio of adjacent businesses and venture studio within American Family Insurance. Prior to that I founded the Desai Accelerator, an intensive program of funding, mentorship, and resources to help early stage ventures scale and succeed. As Managing Director, I recruited and managed investments in 11 tech enabled businesses, including MySwimPro (named 2016 Apple Watch App of the Year), Ash & Erie (featured on Shark Tank) and Companion (recognized by the Today Show, Good Morning America). Over the past several years, I have worked with a variety of startup companies at the Boston-based investment fund TechStars and at the early stage venture capital fund Invest Detroit Ventures. In 2015 I was named Crains Detroit Business "40 under 40" and ‚Äú25 Women in Tech.‚Äù

linkedin description (3): Dogs and cats and cats and dogs. We just love every little furry thing about them; from when they‚Äôre tiny and helpless, as they settle down into our hearts and homes and daily lives, to when they‚Äôre older and in need of extra care. Dogs and cats and cats and dogs. They keep us company, warm our hearts and make us laugh and laugh. And, if you‚Äôre like us, you do the very best you can for your pets; all that you can to keep them healthy, safe, active and happy. At Petcurean, we create premium quality, nutrient-rich food that‚Äôs right for pets, to help our dogs and cats get the most out of their lives with us. We always have, since day one when two good friends started a little family operation in the Fraser Valley of British Columbia, Canada. They were driven by the idea that pets deserved better: that pets deserved food that was made with the same love and care as we put into preparing meals for our own families. To this day, Petcurean remains fiercely independent and lives by the rule of quality first, pets first, without compromise. We‚Äôre pet people, pet owners, pet advocates and yes, more than a little obsessed with proper pet nutrition. You should see us when we‚Äôre talking about what recipes we should be creating; the meats, veggies and fruits we should be including; which rancher, farmer or producer we‚Äôll source from; what flavours we should be considering. It‚Äôs not enough to create a new recipe for the sake of having a new recipe; our foods have to do better than that, our foods have to help pets stay healthy and happy. Think about it; one small piece of kibble contains every ingredient‚Ä¶ the proteins, carbs and fats, the vitamins and minerals your pet needs to sustain and nourish its life. Yup. With every decision we make, every recipe we create, we put pets first. That‚Äôs what we‚Äôve always done, here at Petcurean. And, that‚Äôs what we‚Äôll always do.

summary: I work with organizations and leaders who are trying to do something different, whether that‚Äôs rethinking their strategy, managing change, or building teams that actually function well. My background includes senior roles in higher education, leadership at a fast-growing education technology company, and over 15 years of consulting experience across sectors. Today, I lead transform.forward, a boutique consulting firm focused on strategy, organizational effectiveness, and leadership development. Our clients include public and private universities, government agencies, nonprofits, startups, corporations, and organizations in transition. The work often involves strategic planning, executive coaching, culture audits, org structure reviews, or facilitation of retreats and team development. Before launching transform.forward full time, I served as Chief of Staff and Assistant Vice President at a large private university, where I led division-wide strategy, oversaw $75M in projects and operating budgets, and built teams and systems to support change at scale. Earlier in my career, I helped scale an education tech company through multiple mergers and acquisitions, where I led consulting and research services, integrated marketing, customer advocacy, and product marketing. I‚Äôve taught graduate courses on strategic planning, assessment, and leadership theory, and my research includes topics like gamification, student engagement, and the evolving role of Chief of Staff in complex institutions. I stay connected to the field through writing, speaking, and working directly with leaders who are trying to get unstuck and move forward with clarity.

linkedin description (4): Dale Carnegie helps people from all walks of life become fearless, giving leaders the confidence they need to get the most out of life and work. We offer a variety of courses under six core topics ‚Äì leadership, organizational development, people skills, communication, sales, and customer service - designed to expand and sharpen your or your employees‚Äô skills for a more successful career. linkedin description (3): Our mission is to empower enlisted veterans and service members and amplify their voices as civic leaders by providing them with: (1) a skill bridge that enables a successful transition to the classroom by making them informed consumers of higher education and increasing their confidence to apply to and complete rigorous degree programs at top-tier institutions, and (2) sustained support throughout their pursuit of higher education and into the civilian workforce. In partnership with the nation‚Äôs top colleges and universities, WSP hosts intensive and immersive one and two-week college-preparatory academic boot camps for enlisted veterans and transitioning service members. Boot camps are offered in three disciplines: Humanities, STEM, and Business & Entrepreneurship. Through faculty lectures, workshops and research projects, tailored assignments, and one-on-one tutoring, warrior-scholars acquire the skills to succeed in higher education and navigate the cultural shift from military service to college. Throughout the course, warrior-scholars are mentored by student veterans who have successfully transitioned from the military to college. WSP also offers workshops tailored to address the unique needs of veterans enrolled in community colleges and targeted programming for marginalized veterans, such as our Women Veterans Empowerment Dialogues. All programming is provided at no cost.

summary: I wake up every morning with the goal of helping people and serving our community. Hello! I am currently the CEO/Managing Partner of a human resources and recruitment agency specializing in the areas of recruitment, career transition, and executive coaching. That's the business side. The real purpose is that we strive everyday to change people's lives by being a significant resource, whether it be by assisting you to find a job, seek out leadership coaching, or even assist in your career transition should the circumstances find you without employment. We are here to assist you regardless of where you are in your career journey. Our firm is based on old school values of assisting individuals and clients - we are here for you and genuinely care about you. On top of that, our firm values and understands the importance of community. Our goal is to be known as a company that values community, not-for-profit and youth sport, and lives it every day by our actions and our support. In a prior life I was a senior accounting professional who developed a broad range of experience in all aspects of accounting, auditing and financial management. I had the opportunity to develop work and life experiences with government entities, service entities, post secondary institutions, financial consulting, mining, and construction/oil & gas companies.

linkedin description (3): At NorQuest, we have a unique ability to provide students with the skills Alberta needs in a supportive and inclusive environment. And with input from industry, business, and the public sector, we make learning relevant and rewarding. We understand that our learners come with varying levels of education and we assist them at the times and places that meet their needs, whether that is in the classroom, via distance learning or continuing education. We help identify their strengths, work on their areas of need, and move them towards exciting learning paths and life-changing careers. Our post-secondary diploma and certificate programs offer careers in health, community studies, and business. We also uniquely deliver to the increasing demands of our economy. Thanks to our workforce-relevant programming, the average diploma graduate from NorQuest College earns $15,100 more than a high school graduate at their career midpoint. In addition, research shows that NorQuest College and our students added $471.4 million of total income to Edmonton‚Äôs regional economy. These outcomes are based on a 2016-17 study conducted by Economic Specialists International. Located on traditional lands referred to as Treaty 6 territory, we serve 21,162 learners. This translates to 12,112 full-time and part-time credit students, and 9,050 non-credit or continuing education students, including assessment examinations. As a regional steward, we provide access to adult education in Edmonton and the surrounding region. Our services reach from Drayton Valley in the southwest, to Whitecourt in the northwest, and to Wetaskiwin in the southeast, encompassing 26 communities. In all, three regional campuses complement our two Edmonton campuses. We are proud to embrace diversity and honour inclusiveness.

summary: Hi, I‚Äôm Carlamay Sheremata. I‚Äôm a retired police officer, keynote speaker, award-winning author, and family conflict resolution specialist‚Äîbut more than that, I‚Äôm a bridge-builder. Between systems and people. Between leaders and their teams. Between families and the youth they love. After 21 years in law enforcement‚Äîincluding 8.5 years as a School Resource Officer‚ÄîI‚Äôve seen what happens when people lose connection. I‚Äôve watched families fracture, leaders burn out, teams implode, and kids fall through the cracks. Not because people didn‚Äôt care‚Äîbut because they didn‚Äôt know how to lead through the hard stuff. That‚Äôs why I created the CALM Leadership Method‚Ñ¢‚Äîa trust-centered, emotionally intelligent approach to leadership that works in real life. Under pressure. In crisis. In the moments that matter most. I now help corporate teams, educators, frontline professionals, and families lead with connection, rebuild trust where it‚Äôs been lost, and communicate clearly when it counts most‚Äîat home, at work, and everywhere in between. Whether I‚Äôm on stage speaking to executives, equipping frontline teams, or sitting across from a family in conflict, I bring the same message: Connection heals what correction can‚Äôt. And if we don‚Äôt fix the disconnection, we lose the people who need us most. I‚Äôm also the author of the award-winning book Youth Truth: Engaging in Conversations That Can Change Lives‚Äîa raw, practical guide that equips parents, educators, and mentors to connect with today‚Äôs youth on the tough topics that matter most. It‚Äôs not just a book‚Äîit‚Äôs a bridge between generations, emotions, and relationships. Through real stories, bold truths, and actionable tools, I teach people how to lead with clarity, courage, and compassion‚Äîwithout burning out or checking out. Because when we get connection right, everything changes. What I Speak & Train On: Trust-Centered Leadership in High-Stress Environments The CALM Method‚Ñ¢: From Reactive to Regulated Leadership Building Emotionally Resilient Teams and Families The Bridge Between Home & Work: Leading from the Inside Out Youth Truth‚Ñ¢: Conversations That Reach Today‚Äôs Kids Being Pink in a Blue World: Leading Authentically in Male-Dominated Spaces Let‚Äôs connect if you‚Äôre: A leader ready to retain your people‚Äînot lose them A team burned out from constant crisis A parent, coach, or educator ready to build trust with youth An event planner looking for a speaker who brings heart, humor, and real talk A human who believes leadership starts with presence‚Äînot position Let‚Äôs rebuild trust where it matters most‚Äîtogether.
job description: Diamond in the Rough Consulting is more than a business‚Äîit‚Äôs a movement. We help leaders, teams, and families rebuild trust, lead with emotional intelligence, and reconnect where it matters most‚Äîat home, at work, and in the moments that shape everything. Founded by Carlamay Sheremata, a retired police officer, award-winning author, keynote speaker, and family conflict resolution specialist, our work is grounded in lived experience, not just theory. After 21 years on the frontlines of crisis‚Äîincluding 8.5 years as a School Resource Officer‚ÄîCarlamay created the CALM Leadership Method‚Ñ¢, a powerful, trust-centered approach that equips people to lead with clarity, connection, and courage under pressure. At Diamond in the Rough, we believe disconnection is costing us‚Äîour teams, our families, and our culture. We deliver bold keynotes, interactive workshops, and transformational training that help people communicate clearly, lead through conflict, and restore trust in high-stakes environments. Whether we‚Äôre equipping corporate leaders to retain their teams, training frontline professionals to navigate youth crisis, or guiding families through conflict resolution sessions‚Äîour approach is real, relatable, and results-driven. We don‚Äôt do surface work. We dig deep‚Äîbecause the diamond is always found in the rough. Our services include: Trust-centered keynote speaking Trauma-aware and CALM Method‚Ñ¢ leadership training Youth-focused workshops and educator engagement Customized team development for emotionally intelligent workplaces Family conflict resolution (hourly or package-based support) If you‚Äôre tired of band-aid solutions and want to create lasting change‚Äîfrom the inside out‚Äîthen you‚Äôre in the right place. Let‚Äôs rebuild what‚Äôs been broken and lead the way forward with heart, clarity, and connection. For more information on From Chaos to CALM keynotes and workshops, visit www.carlamaysheremata.com.
job description (2): Youth Truth: Engaging In Conversations That Can Change Lives üìñ Do you know what questions to ASK your kids, students, and the youth in your life to get them to talk with you? Wouldn‚Äôt it be great to have them actually respond and engage in conversation? It really is possible! In Youth Truth, you will discover how to approach the difficult topics that need to be talked about with your kids or students. You can do it with empathy and support. You can create safe spaces where youth feel valued and heard. Youth Truth can enhance your understanding of the issues that youth are dealing with these days. That way, you will know what the right questions are and the right way to ask the questions that actually touch hearts with the young people you want to reach. This gripping book delves into the raw, unfiltered world of today‚Äôs youth. Their lives are way more complex than most realize. It is a compelling and poignant exploration of the challenges faced by young souls, bringing to light the often overlooked and misunderstood battles they fight. From the haunting shadows of suicide to the insidious presence of bullying to the silent struggles of eating disorders and the desperate yearning just to be seen‚Äìthis narrative bares it all. It is a powerful testament to the resilience, strength, and untold stories of a generation yearning for understanding and compassion. More than just a collection of stories, the author, a retired law enforcement and school resource officer, delivers a call to action, emphasizing the critical need for open, honest, and compassionate conversations. Youth Truth highlights how listening and engaging in meaningful dialogue can profoundly impact the lives of young people.

linkedin description: Leaders in executive search and talent acquisition spend their days advising others, managing expectations, navigating pressure, and holding complex human dynamics. They are expected to be decisive, composed, and constantly available, often while absorbing stress from clients, candidates, partners, and teams. The challenge is not a lack of capability. It is the accumulation. The cost shows up as blurred priorities, reactive decision-making, leadership fatigue, and the quiet sense that there is no place to put the weight you are carrying. Leadership in talent and search can feel grounded, clear, and sustainable without losing edge, credibility, or performance. When we work together, leaders gain clearer judgment under pressure, greater confidence navigating client, candidate, and internal dynamics, and practical tools to manage complexity without constant reactivity. The result is steadiness that carries into teams, clients, and decisions. This work supports leaders who are already strong and want to lead with greater clarity, presence, and meaningful connection, particularly in complex, high-pressure environments. I have spent my career in executive search and talent acquisition. I understand the pace, the pressure, and the unspoken expectations that shape this work. My coaching blends leadership experience, talent expertise, and a structured, human-centered approach for leaders who do not need theory. They need clarity. I bring over two decades of experience working alongside senior leaders in executive search, recruiting, and people-driven organizations, including scaling and leading global search operations for a PE-backed talent advisory firm through organic and M&A growth. If this resonates with you or your team, I invite you to schedule a confidential conversation to explore whether coaching support would be useful right now.

linkedin description (4): The American Nicaraguan School (ANS) is a non-profit, non-sectarian, coeducational day school founded in 1944 to provide a college preparatory American educational program from Nursery (Kindergarten age 3) through Grade 12 for students of all nationalities. The School is governed by a 7 member Board of Directors, with 6 members elected by school parents, and one member appointed by the U.S. Embassy. The school community includes members of the diplomatic corps, foreign and local businesses, Nicaraguan government and various international assistance groups working in Nicaragua. The ANS Mission is to provide its multicultural student community with a US-accredited college preparatory program, based on democratic and universal values, that develops critical thinkers and ethical individuals capable of realizing their leadership potential by making meaningful contributions to society. As an AdvancED accredited institution, ANS follows a US-based curriculum while also providing students the opportunity of obtaining the Nicaraguan Bachillerato Diploma. English is the language of instruction through all grade levels, starting in Kinder 3. An innovative approach to education starts early at ANS through Balanced Literacy, Singapore Math and Science Fusion being implemented in the Early Learning Center and Elementary School. Middle School and High School students incorporate technology use in their lessons through the One-to-One Laptop Program. Secondary School students apply their skills through involvement in both curricula and extra-curricular activities. Students challenge themselves by taking classes from the Global Studies Academy Program, picking up a third or fourth language, as well as choosing from 16 academically diverse AP courses, adding to their preparation for attending colleges and universities in the United States and around the world. For information on employment opportunities visit: www.ans.edu.ni/employment/

summary: Hello and thank you for taking the time to learn more about me. I‚Äôm grateful you‚Äôre here. My name is Rachel E. Sanders, DBA, and I am a Principal Consultant and Adjunct Professor. I‚Äôm most proud of finding RESet360 Consulting, LLC, to coach and empower organizations, leaders, and teams, towards an investment in generational intelligence so they can gain a greater understanding of and respond to the unique needs, preferences, and values of each of the four workforce generations they manage. Simply, as a Principal Consultant, I support leaders in Reseting Leadership, Rethinking Strategy and Reimagining their Potential. Additionally, I‚Äôm a student-centered adjunct professor with ample experience translating research into practical strategies for today‚Äôs multigenerational workforce. I have taught undergraduate and graduate students for 4 years in business courses such as Systems Management and Inclusive Leadership, blending academic rigor with real-world insight. My greatest strength lies in my attention to detail and follow through. job description: RESet360 Consulting, LLC is an service-disabled veteran owned small business (SDVOSB) that exists to empower multigenerational leaders, teams, and organizations in public and private sectors by addressing generational biases that often hinder effective leadership and employee satisfaction.
